papers.abstract: Current mainstream biometric user authentication approaches are based on passive measurements of the subject's characteristics, and usually come with less-than-satisfactory accuracy. This paper takes a unique approach to biometric authentication. Specifically, instead of training a machine learning algorithm to recognize a legitimate user, the paper proposes a hybrid type of training, in which the legitimate user is also trained to use a customized instance of the machine. The user thus achieves a level of artificially-induced expertise to interact with the machine, which makes the user easier to recognize. We implement this concept in a mouse-based user authentication system, in which we produce customized machine instances by introducing an angle offset to the standard mouse. Human subjects then rely on their kinesthetic intelligence to achieve motor learning and visual-motor adaptation to the modified mouse. We design a 7-week IRB-approved experiment, collect data from 18 human subjects over this period, and evaluate the proposed approach with two existing state-of-the-art mouse-based authentication schemes. We find that, in both schemes, our approach significantly outperforms the baseline in which a regular unaltered mouse is used. Somewhat surprisingly, results also show that our approach improves the authentication performance even when both legitimate and non-legitimate users are trained to exactly the same instance of customized machine (i.e., the same mouse angle offset). In addition, we also observe that users can generally maintain their learned expertise even after one week of washout, which further demonstrates the practicality of the approach. Finally, we present a practical strategy to manage the enrollment of users in such a proposed system.
papers.abstract_zh: 当前主流的生物特征用户认证方法是基于对象特征的被动测量，并且通常具有不令人满意的准确性。本文采用了一种独特的生物认证方法。具体而言，代替训练机器学习算法来识别合法用户，该论文提出了一种混合类型的训练，其中合法用户也被训练来使用机器的定制实例。因此，用户获得了与机器交互的人工诱导的专业水平，这使得用户更容易被识别。我们在一个基于鼠标的用户认证系统中实现了这个概念，在这个系统中，我们通过向标准鼠标引入一个角度偏移来生成定制的机器实例。然后，人类受试者依靠他们的动觉智能来实现运动学习和对改良小鼠的视觉运动适应。我们设计了一个为期7周的IRB批准的实验，在此期间收集了18名人类受试者的数据，并使用两个现有的最先进的基于鼠标的身份验证方案来评估所提出的方法。我们发现，在这两个方案中，我们的方法明显优于使用常规未改变小鼠的基线。有些令人惊讶的是，结果还表明，即使当合法和非法用户都被训练到完全相同的定制机器实例(即，相同的鼠标角度偏移)时，我们的方法也提高了认证性能。此外，我们还观察到，即使在一周的清洗后，用户通常也可以保持他们学到的专业知识，这进一步证明了该方法的实用性。最后，我们提出了一个实用的策略来管理这样一个系统中的用户注册。
papers.title_zh: 人工智能符合动力学智能：基于鼠标的用户身份验证基于混合人机学习

papers.title: Common Evaluation Pitfalls in Touch-Based Authentication Systems
papers.authors: Martin Georgiev, Simon Eberz, Henry Turner, Giulio Lovisotto, Ivan Martinovic
papers.abstract: In this paper, we investigate common pitfalls affecting the evaluation of authentication systems based on touch dynamics. We consider different factors that lead to misrepresented performance, are incompatible with stated system and threat models or impede reproducibility and comparability with previous work. Specifically, we investigate the effects of (i) small sample sizes (both number of users and recording sessions), (ii) using different phone models in training data, (iii) selecting non-contiguous training data, (iv) inserting attacker samples in training data and (v) swipe aggregation. We perform a systematic review of 30 touch dynamics papers showing that all of them overlook at least one of these pitfalls. To quantify each pitfall's effect, we design a set of experiments and collect a new longitudinal dataset of touch dynamics from 470 users over 31 days comprised of 1,166,092 unique swipes. We make this dataset and our code available online. Our results show significant percentage-point changes in reported mean EER for several pitfalls: including attacker data (2.55%), non-contiguous training data (3.8%), phone model mixing (3.2%-5.8%). We show that, in a common evaluation setting, cumulative effects of these evaluation choices result in a combined difference of 8.9% EER. We also largely observe these effects across the entire ROC curve. Furthermore, we validate the pitfalls on four distinct classifiers - SVM, Random Forest, Neural Network, and kNN. Based on these insights, we propose a set of best practices that, if followed, will lead to more realistic and comparable reporting of results in the field.
papers.abstract_zh: 在本文中，我们研究了影响基于触摸动力学的认证系统评估的常见陷阱。我们考虑导致误报性能、与规定的系统和威胁模型不兼容或妨碍可再现性和与以前工作的可比性的不同因素。具体来说，我们研究了(I)小样本量(包括用户数量和记录会话)，(ii)在训练数据中使用不同的手机型号，(iii)选择不连续的训练数据，(iv)在训练数据中插入攻击者样本，以及(v)刷卡聚合的影响。我们对30篇接触动力学论文进行了系统的回顾，发现它们都忽略了至少一个缺陷。为了量化每个陷阱的影响，我们设计了一组实验，并在31天内从470名用户收集了一个新的触摸动态纵向数据集，其中包括1，166，092次独特的点击。我们把这个数据集和我们的代码放在网上。我们的结果显示，对于几个陷阱，报告的平均EER有显著的百分点变化:包括攻击者数据(2.55%)，非连续训练数据(3.8%)，手机型号混合(3.2%-5.8%)。我们表明，在一个共同的评估设置中，这些评估选择的累积效应导致了8.9% EER的综合差异。我们也在整个ROC曲线上观察了这些效应。此外，我们验证了四个不同的分类器- SVM，随机森林，神经网络和kNN的陷阱。基于这些见解，我们提出了一套最佳做法，如果遵循这些做法，将导致更现实和可比的报告结果在该领域。
papers.title_zh: 基于触摸的身份验证系统中的常见评估陷阱

papers.title: ALEXA VERSUS ALEXA: Controlling Smart Speakers by Self-Issuing Voice Commands
papers.authors: Sergio Esposito, Daniele Sgandurra, Giampaolo Bella
papers.abstract: We present ALEXA VERSUS ALEXA (AvA), a novel attack that leverages audio files containing voice commands and audio reproduction methods in an offensive fashion, to gain control of Amazon Echo devices for a prolonged amount of time. AvA leverages the fact that Alexa running on an Echo device correctly interprets voice commands originated from audio files even when they are played by the device itself -- i.e., it leverages a command self-issue vulnerability. Hence, AvA removes the necessity of having a rogue speaker in proximity of the victim's Echo, a constraint that many attacks share. With AvA, an attacker can self-issue any permissible command to Echo, controlling it on behalf of the legitimate user. We have verified that, via AvA, attackers can control smart appliances within the household, buy unwanted items, tamper linked calendars and eavesdrop on the user. We also discovered two additional Echo vulnerabilities, which we call Full Volume and Break Tag Chain. The Full Volume increases the self-issue command recognition rate, by doubling it on average, hence allowing attackers to perform additional self-issue commands. Break Tag Chain increases the time a skill can run without user interaction, from eight seconds to more than one hour, hence enabling attackers to setup realistic social engineering scenarios. By exploiting these vulnerabilities, the adversary can self-issue commands that are correctly executed 99% of the times and can keep control of the device for a prolonged amount of time. We reported these vulnerabilities to Amazon via their vulnerability research program, who rated them with a Medium severity score. In addition, we discuss the results of a set of tests performed on three voluntary Echo-equipped households to verify the feasibility of AvA in real scenarios, finding that the attack remains undetected and operative in most cases. Finally, to assess limitations of AvA on a larger scale, we provide the results of a survey performed on a study group of 18 users, and we show that most of the limitations against AvA are hardly used in practice.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们介绍了ALEXA vs . ALEXA(AvA)，这是一种新颖的攻击，它以一种进攻的方式利用包含语音命令和音频再现方法的音频文件，来获得对亚马逊Echo设备的长时间控制。AvA利用了在Echo设备上运行的Alexa正确解释源自音频文件的语音命令的事实，即使它们是由设备本身播放的——即，它利用了命令自发布漏洞。因此，AvA消除了在受害者回声附近放置流氓扬声器的必要性，这是许多攻击共有的限制。通过AvA，攻击者可以自行发出任何允许的命令来回应，代表合法用户控制它。我们已经证实，通过AvA，攻击者可以控制家庭中的智能电器，购买不想要的物品，篡改链接日历并窃听用户。我们还发现了另外两个Echo漏洞，我们称之为Full Volume和Break Tag Chain。完整卷提高了自发布命令的识别率，平均提高了一倍，因此允许攻击者执行额外的自发布命令。打破标签链增加了技能在没有用户交互的情况下运行的时间，从八秒增加到一个多小时，从而使攻击者能够设置真实的社会工程场景。通过利用这些漏洞，对手可以自行发出99%正确执行的命令，并可以长时间控制设备。我们通过他们的漏洞研究项目向亚马逊报告了这些漏洞，他们给这些漏洞的严重性评分为中等。此外，我们讨论了在三个自愿配备Echo的家庭中执行的一组测试的结果，以验证AvA在真实场景中的可行性，发现攻击在大多数情况下仍未被检测到并且是有效的。最后，为了在更大的范围内评估AvA的局限性，我们提供了对一个由18名用户组成的研究小组进行的调查结果，我们表明大多数针对AvA的限制在实践中很少使用。
papers.title_zh: Alexa与Alexa：通过自我发行的语音命令控制智能扬声器

papers.title: Byzantine-Robust Private Information Retrieval with Low Communication and Efficient Decoding
papers.authors: Liang Feng Zhang, Huaxiong Wang, Li-Ping Wang
papers.abstract: A b Byzantine-robust K-out-of-ℓ private information retrieval ((b, K,ℓ)-BRPIR) scheme allows a user to retrieve any item of a database from ℓ servers, even if only K out of the ℓ servers respond and at most b out of the K responding servers provide false answers. The existing BRPIR schemes require either an exponential time decoding algorithm or a communication complexity no better than O(n1/(2k-1) k ℓ log ℓ) with k=K-2b. In this paper, we show a new (b,K,ℓ)-BRPIR scheme that has both a polynomial time decoding algorithm and a communication cost of ℓ • exp(O((log n)1-over 1 r (log log n) 1 overr)) for r=log (K/(2b+1)), which is more efficient when n→ ∞.
papers.abstract_zh: b拜占庭健壮的K-out-of-ℓ私人信息检索((b，K,ℓ)-BRPIR)方案允许用户从ℓ服务器检索数据库的任何项目，即使只有k个ℓ服务器响应，并且至多k个响应服务器中的b个提供错误答案。现有的BRPIR方案需要指数时间解码算法或者通信复杂度不优于O(n1/(2k-1) k ℓ对数ℓ),其中k=K-2b。在本文中，我们给出了一个新的b,K,ℓ)-BRPIR方案，对于r=log (K/(2b+1))，该方案具有多项式时间解码算法和ℓexp(o((log n)1-over 1r(log log n)1 overr))的通信代价，当n→ ∞时，该方案更有效。
papers.title_zh: 拜占庭式私人信息检索，沟通低落和有效的解码

papers.title: Secure-Computation-Friendly Private Set Intersection from Oblivious Compact Graph Evaluation
papers.authors: Jack P. K. Ma, Sherman S. M. Chow
papers.abstract: Private set intersection (PSI) is a secure two-party computation ($2$PC) protocol that reveals only the intersection of two private sets. Driven by different applications, various works devise specific protocols for private computation on the intersection (PCI), e.g., summation of the values labeled with each element in the intersection. Upgrading a PSI protocol to PCI for generic computations while maintaining efficiency and preventing leakage is known to be not straightforward (e.g., the intersection set size could be leaked). Ciampi and Orlandi (SCN'18) proposed a generic, one-of-a-kind, and concretely efficient PSI design that is compatible with common 2PC paradigms for realizing PCI, namely, garbled circuits, secret sharing, and homomorphic encryption. Its core is a 2PC protocol for private set membership, ƒ(x, (Y, ({γ0, γ1})) = (γ(x ∈ Y), ⊥), which uses only symmetric-key operations and oblivious transfer. This paper continues their endeavor, which "compresses" the graph representation of set Y to reduce the computation and communication costs (e.g., 40%/58% for the latter, when |Y| = 220 /224 with the security parameter λ = 128). Our protocol is inspired by a recent (outsourceable) 2PC protocol for decision tree evaluation by Ma et al. (NDSS'21). We overcome the challenges of supporting the branching program needed by Ciampi and Orlandi by extending a protocol for a tree, e.g., allowing a node to have multiple "real" and "fake" parents while hiding the "spine" of the branching program without padding the maximum possible number of fake ciphertexts. As a bonus, we extend our PCI protocol to the secure outsourcing setting. Such PCI protocols are scarcer. We also briefly discuss a PCI application in contact tracing for fine-grained privacy control.
papers.abstract_zh: 私有集合交集(PSI)是一个安全的两方计算($2$PC)协议，它只揭示两个私有集合的交集。在不同应用的驱动下，各种工作为交集上的私有计算(PCI)设计了特定的协议，例如，对交集中每个元素标记的值求和。众所周知，将PSI协议升级到PCI以用于通用计算，同时保持效率并防止泄漏并不容易(例如，交集大小可能会被泄漏)。Ciampi和Orlandi (SCN'18)提出了一种通用的、独一无二的、具体有效的PSI设计，该设计与用于实现PCI的常见2PC范例兼容，即乱码电路、秘密共享和同态加密。其核心是一个针对私有集合成员资格的2PC协议，即(x，(y，({γ0，γ1 })=(γ(x∈y)，⊥)，该协议仅使用对称密钥操作和不经意传输。本文继续了他们的努力，即“压缩”集合Y的图形表示以减少计算和通信成本(例如，当|Y| = 220 /224且安全参数λ = 128时，后者为40%/58%)。我们的协议是受马等人最近提出的(可外包的)2PC决策树评估协议的启发(21)。我们通过扩展树的协议来克服支持Ciampi和Orlandi所需的分支程序的挑战，例如，允许节点具有多个“真实”和“虚假”父节点，同时隐藏分支程序的“主干”,而不填充最大可能数量的虚假密文。作为奖励，我们将PCI协议扩展到安全外包设置。这样的PCI协议更少。我们还简要讨论了用于细粒度隐私控制的联系跟踪中的PCI应用程序。
papers.title_zh: 安全计算友好的私人设置交叉路口，可从遗忘的紧凑型图评估

papers.title: PSImple: Practical Multiparty Maliciously-Secure Private Set Intersection
papers.authors: Aner Ben-Efraim, Olga Nissenbaum, Eran Omri, Anat Paskin-Cherniavsky
papers.abstract: Private set intersection (PSI) protocols allow a set of mutually distrustful parties, each holding a private set of items, to compute the intersection over all their sets, such that no other information is revealed. PSI has a wide variety of applications including online advertising (e.g., efficacy computation), security (e.g., botnet detection, intrusion detection), proximity testing (e.g., COVID-19 contact tracing), and more. Private set intersection is a rapidly developing area and there exist many highly efficient protocols. However, almost all of these protocols are for the case of two parties or for semi-honest security. In particular, despite the high interest in this problem, prior to our work there has been no concretely efficient, maliciously secure multiparty PSI protocol. We present PSImple, the first concretely efficient maliciously-secure multiparty PSI protocol. Our construction is based on oblivious transfer and garbled Bloom filters, and has a round-optimal online phase. To demonstrate the practicality of PSImple, we implemented it and ran experiments with up to 32 parties and 2 20 inputs. We show that PSImple is competitive even with the state-of-the-art concretely efficient semi-honest multiparty PSI protocols. Additionally, we revisit the garbled Bloom filter parameters used in the 2-party PSI protocol of Rindal and Rosulek (Eurocrypt 2017). Using a more careful analysis, we show that the size of the garbled Bloom filters and the number of oblivious transfers required for malicious security can be significantly reduced, often by more than 20%. These improved parameters also imply a better security guarantee, and can be used both in the 2-party PSI protocol of Rindal and Rosulek and in i>PSImple.
papers.abstract_zh: 私有集合交集(PSI)协议允许一组互不信任的参与方计算所有集合的交集，从而不会泄露其他信息，其中每个参与方持有一组私有项目。PSI具有广泛的应用，包括在线广告(例如功效计算)、安全(例如僵尸网络检测、入侵检测)、邻近测试(例如新冠肺炎接触追踪)等等。私有集合交集是一个快速发展的领域，存在许多高效的协议。然而，几乎所有这些协议都是针对两方或半诚实安全的情况。特别地，尽管对这个问题非常感兴趣，但是在我们的工作之前，还没有具体有效的、恶意安全的多方PSI协议。我们提出PSImple，第一个具体有效的恶意安全多方PSI协议。我们的构造是基于不经意传输和乱码布隆过滤器，并有一个轮最佳在线阶段。为了展示PSImple的实用性，我们实现了它，并对多达32个团体和2 20个输入进行了实验。我们证明PSImple甚至可以与最新的具体有效的半诚实多方PSI协议相媲美。此外，我们重新审视了Rindal和Rosulek (Eurocrypt 2017)的双方PSI协议中使用的混乱的Bloom filter参数。通过更仔细的分析，我们发现恶意安全所需的乱码布隆过滤器的大小和不经意传输的数量可以显著减少，通常减少20%以上。这些改进的参数还意味着更好的安全保证，并且可以用于Rindal和Rosulek的双方PSI协议以及i>PSImple中。
papers.title_zh: PSIMPLE：实用多方恶意安全私人套件交叉路口

papers.title: VERICONDOR: End-to-End Verifiable Condorcet Voting without Tallying Authorities
papers.authors: Luke Harrison, Samiran Bag, Hang Luo, Feng Hao
papers.abstract: Condorcet voting, first proposed by Marquis de Condorcet in the 18th century, chooses a winner of an election as one that defeats every other candidate by a simple majority. According to Condorcet's criterion, a Condorcet winner is the socially optimal choice in a multi-candidate election. However, despite the crucial importance of this voting system in social-choice theory, it has not been widely used in practical applications. This is partly due to the complex tallying procedure, and also the fact that several candidates may form a tie. Existing systems that provide online Condorcet voting services in the real world try to speed up the tallying process by collecting and tallying Condorcet ballots in a digital form. However, they require voters to completely trust the server. In this paper, we propose VERICONDO, the first end-to-end verifiable Condorcet e-voting system without any tallying authorities. Our system allows a voter to fully verify the tallying integrity without involving any trustworthy tallying authorities and provides strong protection of the ballot secrecy. One main challenge in our work lies in proving the well-formedness of an encrypted ballot while being able to tally the ballots in a publicly verifiable yet privacy-preserving manner. We overcome this challenge by adopting a pairwise comparison matrix and applying a novel vector-sum technique to achieve exceptional efficiency. The overall computational cost per ballot is O (n2) where n is the number of candidates. This is probably the best that one may hope for given the use of a n x n matrix to record a Condorcet ballot. In case of a tie, we show how to apply known Condorcet methods to break the tie in a publicly verifiable manner. Finally, we present a prototype implementation and benchmark performance to show the feasibility of our system.
papers.abstract_zh: 孔多塞投票法由孔多塞侯爵在18世纪首次提出，选出以简单多数击败所有其他候选人的获胜者。根据孔多塞的标准，孔多塞获奖者是多候选人选举中的社会最优选择。然而，尽管这种投票系统在社会选择理论中至关重要，它还没有在实际应用中广泛使用。这部分是由于复杂的计票程序，以及几个候选人可能形成平局的事实。现实世界中提供在线孔多塞投票服务的现有系统试图通过以数字形式收集和计票孔多塞选票来加速计票过程。但是，它们要求投票者完全信任服务器。在本文中，我们提出了VERICONDO，这是第一个没有任何计票机构的端到端可验证的孔多塞电子投票系统。我们的系统允许投票者在不涉及任何可信计票机构的情况下完全验证计票的完整性，并为投票的保密性提供了强有力的保护。我们工作中的一个主要挑战在于证明加密选票的格式良好，同时能够以公开可验证且保护隐私的方式计票。我们通过采用成对比较矩阵和应用新颖的矢量和技术来实现卓越的效率，从而克服了这一挑战。每次投票的总计算成本是O (n2 ),其中n是候选人的数量。考虑到使用n×n矩阵来记录孔多塞选票，这可能是人们所希望的最好结果。在平局的情况下，我们展示如何应用已知的孔多塞方法以公开可验证的方式打破平局。最后，我们提出了一个原型实现和基准性能来展示我们的系统的可行性。
papers.title_zh: Vericondor：端到端可验证的Condorcet投票而无需统计当局

papers.title: EPID with Efficient Proof of Non-Revocation
papers.authors: Olivier Sanders
papers.abstract: EPID systems are anonymous authentication mechanisms which are standardized by ISO/IEC and massively deployed in Intel processors. They are related to the large family of privacy-preserving signatures but differ in that they provide a very pragmatic way of revoking members. Concretely, a member ℘ can be revoked by simply placing one of its signatures in a so-called signature revocation list SRL. Once this is done, every signer will have to include in its future signatures a proof that it has not generated any element of SRL, which implicitly revokes ℘. This proof of non-revocation generated by each signer is thus the core component of EPID systems and largely dominates the overall complexity. Yet, it appears that it has been a secondary concern for existing constructions that usually implement it using some costly modular zero-knowledge proofs. In this paper, we reconsider this problem by proposing a new EPID system with a much more efficient proof of non-revocation. The latter is no longer zero-knowledge but its combination with the other components of the EPID system still results in an anonymous signature. Proving the latter point is actually quite complex and requires to tweak these other components but in the end it leads to EPID signatures that are up to three times smaller than previous ones and that can be generated and verified with two times less computations.
papers.abstract_zh: EPID系统是由ISO/IEC标准化的匿名认证机制，大量部署在英特尔处理器中。它们与大家族的隐私保护签名相关，但不同之处在于它们提供了一种非常实用的撤销成员的方法。具体地，成员℘可以通过简单地将其签名之一放入所谓的签名撤销列表SRL中来撤销。一旦完成这一步，每个签名者将不得不在其未来的签名中包含一个证据，证明它没有生成任何SRL元素，这隐含地废除了℘.因此，由每个签名者生成的不可撤销证明是EPID系统的核心组成部分，并且在很大程度上决定了整个系统的复杂性。然而，对于通常使用一些昂贵的模块化零知识证明来实现它的现有构造来说，它似乎已经成为次要问题。在本文中，我们通过提出一个新的EPID系统来重新考虑这个问题，该系统具有更有效的不可撤销性证明。后者不再是零知识，但是它与EPID系统的其他组件的组合仍然产生匿名签名。证明后一点实际上非常复杂，需要调整这些其他组件，但最终它会导致EPID签名比以前的签名小三倍，并且可以用两倍少的计算来生成和验证。
papers.title_zh: epid具有有效的非重生证明

papers.title: Wolf at the Door: Preventing Install-Time Attacks in npm with Latch
papers.authors: Elizabeth Wyss, Alexander Wittman, Drew Davidson, Lorenzo De Carli
papers.abstract: The npm software ecosystem allows developers to easily import code written by others. However, manual vetting of every individual installed component is made difficult in many cases by the number of transitive dependencies brought in by installing popular packages. This has enabled attackers to propagate malicious code by hiding it deep into the dependency chains of popular packages. A particularly dangerous form of attack comes from malicious code embedded into package install scripts. We tackle the problem of preventing undesirable install-time behavior by proposing Latch, a system for mediating install-time capabilities of npm packages. Latch generates permission manifests summarizing each package's install-time behavior and checks them against user-defined policies to ensure compliance. Policies in Latch are expressed in a rich formal policy language that covers a broad range of use cases. Our key insight is that expressive Latch policies empower users to define and enforce their own individualized security needs. Evaluation of practical Latch policies on all publicly available npm packages and on a number of real-world attack packages demonstrates that our approach is effective in identifying and stopping unwanted behavior while minimizing disruption due to undesired alerts.
papers.abstract_zh: npm软件生态系统允许开发人员轻松导入他人编写的代码。然而，在许多情况下，由于安装流行的软件包带来了大量的可传递的依赖关系，手工检查每个单独安装的组件变得很困难。这使得攻击者能够通过将恶意代码隐藏在流行软件包的依赖链中来传播恶意代码。一种特别危险的攻击形式来自嵌入到软件包安装脚本中的恶意代码。我们通过提出Latch来解决防止不希望的安装时行为的问题，Latch是一个用于协调npm包的安装时功能的系统。Latch生成权限清单，总结每个包的安装时行为，并根据用户定义的策略检查它们，以确保符合性。Latch中的策略以丰富的正式策略语言表达，涵盖了广泛的用例。我们的关键见解是，表达性闩锁策略使用户能够定义和实施他们自己的个性化安全需求。对所有公开可用的npm包和一些真实世界的攻击包的实际闩锁策略的评估表明，我们的方法在识别和阻止不必要的行为方面是有效的，同时最大限度地减少了由不必要的警报引起的中断。
papers.title_zh: 门口的狼：防止在闩锁中安装NPM的时间攻击

papers.title: Stegozoa: Enhancing WebRTC Covert Channels with Video Steganography for Internet Censorship Circumvention
papers.authors: Gabriel Figueira, Diogo Barradas, Nuno Santos
papers.abstract: Several totalitarian states around the world deploy sophisticated censorship apparatuses to prevent citizens from freely accessing the Internet. To counter these restrictions, some censorship-circumven-tion tools establish covert channels through the media streams of popular conferencing applications. A recent tool named Protozoa allows for establishing high-performing, peer-to-peer covert channels over WebRTC media streams. However, Protozoa is vulnerable to potential man-in-the-middle attacks. This may occur in cases where WebRTC applications rely on WebRTC gateways to mediate users' connections. In such cases, an adversary that controls the WebRTC gateway can inspect the content of the media streams and trivially detect the transmission of covert payload. This work proposes Stegozoa, a new censorship-circumvention tool that aims to foil the ability of adversaries in control of WebRTC gateways to detect covert data transmissions. Specifically, Stegozoa steganographically embeds covert data into the WebRTC video signal, preventing the detection of the covert payload through direct video content inspection. To this end, Stegozoa leverages state-of-the-art steganography techniques, applying them deep within WebRTC's video coding pipeline and fine-tuning them to efficiently use the available covert channel capacity while ensuring undetectability. We have fully implemented Stegozoa based on an instrumented Chromium codebase. Our evaluation reveals that Stegozoa can create secure WebRTC covert channels that are highly resistant to steganalysis and traffic analysis attacks. Despite the expected reduction in performance that was traded for stronger security, Stegozoa can deliver a reasonable throughput, allowing its users to run low-bandwidth message exchanging tasks.
papers.abstract_zh: 世界各地的几个极权国家部署了复杂的审查机制来阻止公民自由访问互联网。为了应对这些限制，一些审查规避工具通过流行的会议应用程序的媒体流建立秘密通道。最近一个名为“原生动物”的工具允许在WebRTC媒体流上建立高性能的点对点隐蔽通道。然而，原生动物容易受到潜在的中间人攻击。当WebRTC应用程序依赖WebRTC网关作为用户连接的媒介时，可能会出现这种情况。在这种情况下，控制WebRTC网关的对手可以检查媒体流的内容，并轻易地检测到秘密有效负载的传输。这项工作提出了Stegozoa，一种新的审查规避工具，旨在挫败控制WebRTC网关的对手检测秘密数据传输的能力。具体来说，Stegozoa隐写术将隐蔽数据嵌入到WebRTC视频信号中，防止通过直接视频内容检查检测到隐蔽有效载荷。为此，Stegozoa利用最先进的隐写术技术，将其深入应用到WebRTC的视频编码管道中，并对其进行微调，以有效利用可用的隐蔽通道容量，同时确保不可检测性。我们已经完全实现了基于Chromium代码库的Stegozoa。我们的评估表明，Stegozoa可以创建安全的WebRTC隐蔽通道，高度抵御隐写分析和流量分析攻击。尽管预期的性能下降是以更强的安全性为代价的，但Stegozoa可以提供合理的吞吐量，允许其用户运行低带宽的消息交换任务。
papers.title_zh: Stegozoa：通过视频隐身仪式增强WEBRTC秘密频道，用于互联网审查

papers.title: Server-Side Browsers: Exploring the Web's Hidden Attack Surface
papers.authors: Marius Musch, Robin Kirchner, Max Boll, Martin Johns
papers.abstract: As websites grow ever more dynamic and load more of their content on the fly, automatically interacting with them via simple tools like curl is getting less of an option. Instead, headless browsers with JavaScript support, such as PhantomJS and Puppeteer, have gained traction on the Web over the last few years. For various use cases like messengers and social networks that display link previews, these browsers visit arbitrary, user-controlled URLs. To avoid compromise through known vulnerabilities, these browsers need to be diligently kept up-to-date. In this paper, we investigate the phenomenon of what we coin server-side browsers at scale and find that many websites are running severely outdated browsers on the server-side. Remarkably, the majority of them had not been updated for more than 6 months and over 60% of the discovered implementations were found to be vulnerable to publicly available proof-of-concept exploits.
papers.abstract_zh: 随着网站变得越来越动态，动态地加载更多的内容，通过像curl这样的简单工具自动地与它们交互越来越少了。相反，支持JavaScript的无头浏览器，如PhantomJS和Puppeteer，在过去几年中已经在Web上获得了牵引力。对于显示链接预览的各种用例，如信使和社交网络，这些浏览器访问任意的、用户控制的URL。为了避免已知漏洞造成的危害，这些浏览器需要不断更新。在本文中，我们调查了大规模使用服务器端浏览器的现象，发现许多网站在服务器端运行着严重过时的浏览器。值得注意的是，它们中的大多数已经超过6个月没有更新，并且发现超过60%的实现容易受到公开的概念证明攻击。
papers.title_zh: 服务器端浏览器：探索网络的隐藏攻击表面

papers.title: Port Contention Goes Portable: Port Contention Side Channels in Web Browsers
papers.authors: Thomas Rokicki, Clémentine Maurice, Marina Botvinnik, Yossi Oren
papers.abstract: Microarchitectural side-channel attacks can derive secrets from the execution of vulnerable programs. Their implementation in web browsers represents a considerable extension of their attack surface, as a user simply browsing a malicious website, or even a malicious third-party advertisement in a benign cross-origin isolated website, can be a victim. In this paper, we present the first port contention side channel running entirely in a web browser, despite a highly challenging environment. Our attack can be used to build a cross-browser covert channel with a bit rate of 200bps, one order of magnitude above the state of the art, and has a spatial resolution of 1024 native instructions in a side-channel attack, a performance on-par with Prime+Probe attacks. We provide a framework to evaluate the port contention caused by WebAssembly instructions on Intel processors, allowing to increase the portability of port contention side channels. We conclude from our work that port contention attacks are not only fast, they are also less susceptible to noise than cache attacks, and are immune to countermeasures implemented in browsers as well as most side channel countermeasures, which target the cache in their vast majority.
papers.abstract_zh: 微体系结构旁道攻击可以从易受攻击程序的执行中获取秘密。它们在web浏览器中的实现相当大程度上扩展了它们的攻击面，因为用户只需浏览恶意网站，甚至是良性跨源隔离网站中的恶意第三方广告，就可能成为受害者。在本文中，我们介绍了第一个完全在web浏览器中运行的端口争用侧信道，尽管环境极具挑战性。我们的攻击可以用来建立一个跨浏览器的隐蔽通道，比特率为200bps，比现有技术高出一个数量级，在侧通道攻击中具有1024条本机指令的空间分辨率，性能与Prime+Probe攻击相当。我们提供了一个框架来评估由英特尔处理器上的WebAssembly指令引起的端口争用，从而提高端口争用侧通道的可移植性。我们从我们的工作中得出结论，端口争用攻击不仅速度快，而且比缓存攻击更不易受到噪声的影响，并且不受浏览器中实施的对策以及大多数旁路对策的影响，这些对策绝大多数都以缓存为目标。
papers.title_zh: 端口竞争可移植：Web浏览器中的端口竞争侧通道

papers.title: Lures for Money: A First Look into YouTube Videos Promoting Money-Making Apps
papers.authors: Noshaba Nasir, Faqia Iqbal, Mahnoor Zaheer, Mariam Shahjahan, Mobin Javed
papers.abstract: YouTube hosts a wide variety of user-generated videos accessible to a global population of users. The potential of videos to persuade users by engaging them with the experience of the content creator makes them an attractive medium for promoting various kinds of products and services, including apps and websites. The Youtubers promoting these products online may not necessarily be aware of the harms to which they might expose potential users. In fact, they may neither have the incentive nor the technical expertise to look into potential harms. In this work, we uncover one such ecosystem, where the Youtubers are primarily driven by earning money from their channels, but in doing so expose their audience to fraudulent apps. We collect and analyze a dataset of YouTube videos promoting money making apps. Such videos convince users (primarily in developing regions) that they can make money by downloading and installing the mobile apps being promoted, and performing simple tasks such as watching videos, installing other apps, or playing games. We study the popularity of these videos and apps, as well as illuminate the types of tasks they promote, and whether these apps are potentially malicious.
papers.abstract_zh: YouTube上有各种各样的用户制作的视频，可供全球用户访问。视频通过吸引用户参与内容创作者的体验来说服用户的潜力，使其成为推广各种产品和服务(包括应用程序和网站)的有吸引力的媒体。在网上推广这些产品的Youtubers用户可能不一定意识到它们可能会给潜在用户带来的危害。事实上，他们可能既没有动力也没有技术专长去调查潜在的危害。在这项工作中，我们揭示了一个这样的生态系统，其中Youtubers主要是通过从他们的渠道赚钱来驱动的，但这样做使他们的观众暴露在欺诈性的应用程序面前。我们收集并分析了一组推广赚钱应用的YouTube视频。这类视频让用户(主要是发展中地区的用户)相信，他们可以通过下载和安装正在推广的移动应用，以及执行观看视频、安装其他应用或玩游戏等简单任务来赚钱。我们研究这些视频和应用程序的受欢迎程度，以及它们所宣传的任务类型，以及这些应用程序是否具有潜在的恶意。
papers.title_zh: 诱饵赚钱：首次查看YouTube视频，以促进赚钱应用程序

papers.title: Depth, Breadth, and Complexity: Ways to Attack and Defend Deep Learning Models
papers.authors: Firuz Juraev, Eldor Abdukhamidov, Mohammed Abuhamad, Tamer Abuhmed
papers.abstract: Deep Learning is rapidly evolving to the point that it can be used in crucial safety and security applications, including self-driving vehicles, surveillance, drones, and robots. However, these deep learning models are vulnerable to attacks based on adversarial samples that are undetectable to the human eye but cause the model to misbehave. There is an increasing demand for comprehensive and in-depth analysis of behaviors of various attacks and the possible defenses against common deep learning models under several adversarial scenarios. In this study, we conducted four separate investigations. First, we examine the relationship between the model's complexity and its robustness against the studied attacks. Second, the connection between the performance and diversity of models is examined. Third, the first and second experiments were tested across different datasets to explore the impact of the dataset on the performance of the model. Four, throughout the defense strategies, the model behavior is extensively investigated. The code, trained models, and detailed settings and results are available at: https://github.com/InfoLab-SKKU/ML-Adversarial-Attacks-Analysis
papers.abstract_zh: 深度学习正在迅速发展，可以用于关键的安全和安保应用，包括自动驾驶汽车、监控、无人机和机器人。然而，这些深度学习模型容易受到基于人眼无法检测的敌对样本的攻击，但会导致模型行为不端。人们越来越需要全面、深入地分析各种攻击的行为，以及在几种对抗场景下针对常见深度学习模型的可能防御措施。在这项研究中，我们进行了四项独立的调查。首先，我们检查模型的复杂性和它对所研究的攻击的鲁棒性之间的关系。其次，研究了模型的性能和多样性之间的关系。第三，第一个和第二个实验在不同的数据集上进行测试，以探索数据集对模型性能的影响。第四，在整个防御策略中，模型行为被广泛研究。代码、经过训练的模型以及详细的设置和结果可从以下网址获得:https://github . com/info lab-SKKU/ML-Adversarial-Attacks-Analysis
papers.title_zh: 深度，广度和复杂性：攻击和捍卫深度学习模型的方法

papers.title: Privacy Guarantees of BLE Contact Tracing for COVID-19 and Beyond: A Case Study on COVIDWISE
papers.authors: Salman Ahmed, Ya Xiao, Taejoong (Tijay) Chung, Carol J. Fung, Moti Yung, Danfeng (Daphne) Yao
papers.abstract: Google and Apple jointly introduced a digital contact tracing technology and an API called "exposure notification,'' to help health organizations and governments with contact tracing. The technology and its interplay with security and privacy constraints require investigation. In this study, we examine and analyze the security, privacy, and reliability of the technology with actual and typical scenarios (and expected typical adversary in mind), and quite realistic use cases. We do it in the context of Virginia's COVIDWISE app. This experimental analysis validates the properties of the system under the above conditions, a result that seems crucial for the peace of mind of the exposure notification technology adopting authorities, and may also help with the system's transparency and overall user trust.
papers.abstract_zh: 谷歌和苹果联合推出了一种数字接触追踪技术和一种称为“暴露通知”的API，以帮助卫生组织和政府追踪接触者。这项技术及其与安全和隐私限制的相互作用需要调查。在本研究中，我们通过实际和典型的场景(以及预期的典型对手)以及相当现实的用例来检查和分析该技术的安全性、隐私性和可靠性。我们是在弗吉尼亚的COVIDWISE应用程序的背景下做的。该实验分析验证了系统在上述条件下的属性，该结果对于暴露通知技术采用机构的安心而言似乎是至关重要的，并且还可以有助于系统的透明度和整体用户信任。
papers.title_zh: BLE联系跟踪Covid-19及以后的隐私保证：关于COVIDWIESS的案例研究

papers.title: A Systematic Study of Bulletin Board and Its Application
papers.authors: Misni Harjo Suwito, Bayu Adhi Tama, Bagus Santoso, Sabyasachi Dutta, Haowen Tan, Yoshifumi Ueshige, Kouichi Sakurai
papers.abstract: Any person can post arbitrary strings on the bulletin board. Following publication on bulletin board, a party receives a "evidence" that the intended data were posted. The bulletin board is open to the public, which means that anyone can view its contents. The fundamental security criteria for a BB are that its contents cannot be deleted, and that no evidence of publication can be falsified. BB was commonly perceived as a trusted and publicly verifiable channel. It formed the backbone of many important protocols such as e-voting, secure multi-party computation etc. and quite often it was assumed to exist to support the execution of the main protocol. After the advent of blockchain technology, BB systems has found a strong footing regarding its implementation in a distributed manner. In this paper, we aim to provide a concise summary of the evolution of bulletin board, its implementation issues and security analysis with an emphasis on its impact to e-voting systems.
papers.abstract_zh: 任何人都可以在公告板上张贴任意字符串。在公告栏上发布后，一方会收到一份“证据”,表明预期的数据已经发布。公告板对公众开放，这意味着任何人都可以查看它的内容。BB的基本安全标准是其内容不能被删除，并且发布的证据不能被伪造。BB通常被认为是一个可信的、可公开验证的渠道。它构成了许多重要协议的基础，如电子投票、安全多方计算等。并且通常认为它的存在是为了支持主协议的执行。在区块链技术出现后，BB系统公司已经找到了一个强有力的分布式实施的立足点。在本文中，我们的目的是提供一个简明的总结，电子公告板的发展，其实施问题和安全分析，重点是其对电子投票系统的影响。
papers.title_zh: 公告板及其应用的系统研究

papers.title: Black-box and Target-specific Attack Against Interpretable Deep Learning Systems
papers.authors: Eldor Abdukhamidov, Firuz Juraev, Mohammed Abuhamad, Tamer Abuhmed
papers.abstract: Deep neural network models are susceptible to malicious manipulations even in the black-box settings. Providing explanations for DNN models offers a sense of security by human involvement, which reveals whether the sample is benign or adversarial even though previous studies achieved a high attack success rate. However, interpretable deep learning systems (IDLSes) are shown to be susceptible to adversarial manipulations in white-box settings. Attacking IDLSes in black-box settings is challenging and remains an open research domain. In this work, we propose a black-box version of the white-box AdvEdge approach against IDLSes, which is query-efficient and gradient-free without obtaining any knowledge of the target DNN model and its coupled interpreter. Our approach takes advantage of transfer-based and score-based techniques using the effective microbial genetic algorithm (MGA). We achieve a high attack success rate with a small number of queries and high similarity in interpretations between adversarial and benign samples.
papers.abstract_zh: 即使在黑盒设置中，深度神经网络模型也容易受到恶意操纵。为DNN模型提供解释通过人类的参与提供了安全感，这揭示了样本是良性的还是对抗性的，即使先前的研究实现了高攻击成功率。然而，可解释的深度学习系统(IDLSes)在白盒设置中容易受到对抗性操作的影响。在黑盒环境中攻击IDLSes具有挑战性，并且仍然是一个开放的研究领域。在这项工作中，我们提出了一个针对IDLSes的白盒AdvEdge方法的黑盒版本，它是查询有效的和无梯度的，无需获得目标DNN模型及其耦合解释器的任何知识。我们的方法利用了基于转移和基于分数的技术，使用了有效的微生物遗传算法(MGA)。我们用少量的查询和在敌对和良性样本之间的解释中的高相似性实现了高攻击成功率。
papers.title_zh: 黑框和针对可解释的深度学习系统的特定目标攻击

papers.title: Base64 Malleability in Practice
papers.authors: Konstantinos Chalkias, Panagiotis Chatzigiannis
papers.abstract: Base64 encoding has been a popular method to encode binary data into printable ASCII characters. It is commonly used in several serialization protocols, web, and logging applications, while it is oftentimes the preferred method for human-readable database fields. However, while convenient and with a better compression rate than hex-encoding, the large number of base64 variants in relted standards and proposed padding-mode optionality have been proven problematic in terms of security and cross-platform compatibility. This paper addresses a potential attack vector in the base64 decoding phase, where multiple different encodings can successfully decode into the same data, effectively breaking string uniqueness guarantees. The latter might result to log mismatches, denial of service attacks and duplicated database entries, among the others. Apart from documenting why canonicity can be broken by a malleable encoder, we also present an unexpected result, where most of today's base64 decoder libraries are not 100% compatible in their default settings. Some surprising results include the non-compatible behavior of major Rust base64 crates and between popular Javascript and NodeJS base64 implementations. Finally, we propose ways and test vectors for mitigating these issues until a more permanent solution is widely adopted.
papers.abstract_zh: Base64编码是将二进制数据编码成可打印ASCII字符的常用方法。它通常用于多种序列化协议、web和日志记录应用程序，同时也是人类可读数据库领域的首选方法。然而，尽管方便并且具有比十六进制编码更好的压缩率，但是相关标准中的大量base64变体和提议的填充模式可选性已经被证明在安全性和跨平台兼容性方面存在问题。本文解决了base64解码阶段的一个潜在攻击媒介，在这一阶段，多种不同的编码可以成功解码成相同的数据，从而有效地破坏字符串唯一性保证。后者可能导致日志不匹配、拒绝服务攻击和重复的数据库条目等。除了记录可延展编码器破坏规范性的原因，我们还展示了一个意想不到的结果，即当今大多数base64解码器库在默认设置下并不是100%兼容。一些令人惊讶的结果包括主要Rust base64框架的不兼容行为，以及流行的Javascript和NodeJS base64实现之间的不兼容行为。最后，我们提出了缓解这些问题的方法和测试向量，直到更持久的解决方案被广泛采用。
papers.title_zh: base64实践中的锻造性

papers.title: IoT System Trustworthiness Assurance
papers.authors: Razvan Beuran, Ooi Sian En, Abbie O. Barbir, Yasuo Tan
papers.abstract: As the Internet of Things (IoT) becomes more and more pervasive, encompassing many aspects of our daily life, the issue of how much the IoT systems can be trusted is critical. However, the multitude of recent incidents that were caused by or somehow involved such systems, often with dire consequences, makes it obvious that IoT system trustworthiness is not yet attained. In this paper we provide an overview on IoT trustworthiness, and introduce a trustworthiness assurance methodology based on the novel concept of Trustworthiness Assurance Levels (TALs). The methodology is intended for analyzing IoT systems to determine the degree of confidence one can have that they will perform as expected for a given deployment, taking into consideration external disturbances, system errors, faults and attacks. The paper also includes a case study discussion to demonstrate the applicability of the proposed methodology.
papers.abstract_zh: 随着物联网(IoT)变得越来越普遍，涵盖了我们日常生活的许多方面，物联网系统的可信度问题变得至关重要。然而，最近由这种系统引起或以某种方式涉及这种系统的大量事件(通常具有可怕的后果)表明，物联网系统的可信度尚未达到。本文对物联网可信度进行了概述，并介绍了一种基于可信度保证级别(TALs)新概念的可信度保证方法。该方法旨在分析物联网系统，以确定在考虑外部干扰、系统错误、故障和攻击的情况下，人们对其在给定部署中的表现的信心程度。该文件还包括一个案例研究讨论，以证明所提出的方法的适用性。
papers.title_zh: 物联网系统可信度保证

papers.title: Vulnerability Detection via Multimodal Learning: Datasets and Analysis
papers.authors: Xin Zhou, Rakesh M. Verma
papers.abstract: A vulnerability is a weakness that can be exploited by an attacker, e.g., performing unauthorized actions within a computer system. For example, privilege escalation is a type of vulnerability in software, which can be used to gain elevated access to resources that are normally protected from an application or user. However, most applications contain vulnerabilities, some are fixed over time by patches, but many are discovered only after exploitation, which results in steep costs. Furthermore, program analysis tools are generally quite difficult to use. Security analysts still do manual investigation on software, i.e., using static analysis tools on machine code or source code to find bugs. Multimodal learning has been widely used in image processing, but is rarely seen in software security. We introduce a new dataset for multimodal deep learning, MVDSC-C (Multisource for Vulnerability Detection in Source Code - C/C++). Our preliminary results show that combined modalities perform better than single modalities.
papers.abstract_zh: 漏洞是可被攻击者利用的弱点，例如，在计算机系统内执行未授权的动作。例如，特权提升是软件中的一种漏洞，它可以被用来获得对资源的提升访问权限，这些资源通常受到保护，不被应用程序或用户访问。然而，大多数应用程序都包含漏洞，一些漏洞随着时间的推移通过修补程序得以修复，但许多漏洞是在被利用后才被发现的，这导致了高昂的成本。此外，程序分析工具通常很难使用。安全分析师仍然对软件进行人工调查，即使用机器代码或源代码上的静态分析工具来发现bug。多模态学习已经广泛应用于图像处理，但在软件安全领域还很少见。我们为多模态深度学习引入了一个新的数据集，MVDSC-C(源代码中用于漏洞检测的多源- C/C++)。我们的初步结果表明，联合模式比单一模式表现更好。
papers.title_zh: 通过多模式学习检测脆弱性检测：数据集和分析

papers.title: RBMon: Real Time System Behavior Monitoring Tool
papers.authors: Nitesh Kumar, Anand Handa, Sandeep K. Shukla
papers.abstract: There are several security tools available to tackle cyber threats, but the sophistication of attacks leads to the failure of defense mechanisms. Among such tools, endpoint security agents are much prominent to safeguard organizations from potential threats. To monitor and investigate systems for unpredictable modifications and proof of tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTP) used by malware writers. In this work, we develop a real-time system behavior monitoring solution. We use three modules - monitoring, analysis, and mapping to counter the threats based on attack patterns. All three modules have their unique mechanism and are interconnected. The monitoring agent is developed for the Windows platform using the C++ programming language, which captures Windows kernel-level system events in a multi-threaded form. It captures critical information such as - network activity, registry, file, accessed paths, processes, etc. The monitoring agent ships the collected events to the analysis module. In the analysis module, we perform analysis in three phases: rule-based, machine learning (ML)-based, and risk-assessment. Rule-based mechanism finds the Indicator of Compromises (IoCs) from the system events related to exploits, web shell, malicious documents, etc. The ML-based analysis gives an overall understanding of normal vs. suspicious behavior. The risk-assessment analysis uses rule-based and ML-based analysis outputs, to provide the risk-score based on the number of IoCs detected and the suspicious behavior predicted. In the mapping phase, we offer an interactive dashboard to the end-user for visualizing all the activities and the analysis outcomes like running processes, suspicious processes, network activities, port accessed, suspicious paths accessed by a single process, etc., using Kibana. The designed tool monitors the system events in near real-time and reports any suspicious activity that helps in mitigating the threats posed to the user. Hence, it acts as a comprehensive security solution with multi-dimensional capabilities.
papers.abstract_zh: 有几种安全工具可用于应对网络威胁，但攻击的复杂性导致防御机制的失败。在这些工具中，端点安全代理在保护组织免受潜在威胁方面非常突出。监控和调查系统的不可预测的修改和恶意软件作者使用的战术、技术和程序(TTP)的证据。在这项工作中，我们开发了一个实时系统行为监控解决方案。我们使用三个模块-监控、分析和映射来应对基于攻击模式的威胁。所有三个模块都有其独特的机制，并且是相互关联的。监控代理是使用C++编程语言为Windows平台开发的，它以多线程的形式捕获Windows内核级系统事件。它捕获关键信息，如网络活动、注册表、文件、访问路径、进程等。监控代理将收集的事件发送到分析模块。在分析模块中，我们分三个阶段执行分析:基于规则、基于机器学习(ML)和风险评估。基于规则的机制从与漏洞、web外壳、恶意文档等相关的系统事件中发现危害指示器(IOC)。基于ML的分析给出了对正常和可疑行为的总体理解。风险评估分析使用基于规则和基于ML的分析输出，根据检测到的IOC数量和预测的可疑行为提供风险评分。在映射阶段，我们为最终用户提供一个交互式仪表板，用于可视化所有活动和分析结果，如运行的流程、可疑流程、网络活动、访问的端口、单个流程访问的可疑路径等。，使用Kibana。设计的工具以接近实时的方式监控系统事件，并报告任何可疑活动，这有助于减轻对用户构成的威胁。因此，它是一个具有多维功能的综合安全解决方案。
papers.title_zh: rbmon：实时系统行为监控工具

papers.title: The Personalities of Social Media Posts and Photos
papers.authors: Anne Wagner, Anna Bakas, Daisy Reyes, Shelia Kennison, Eric Chan-Tin
papers.abstract: What a person chooses to share on social media can be very telling as to what their personality is. A person can show their personality through how many photos they post, what kinds of photos they post, and what kind of language they tend to use. This research investigates the correlation between a person's personality type and the photos and tweets which that person posts. Social media information and personality types were collected from two different platforms, SONA (college-age students) and MTurk (crowdsourcing platform). The same survey was given to both platforms. Participants answered questions pertaining to their personality, and based on these answers were assigned a True Color and scores for Big Five. Our results show that people who identified with the green True Color self schema tended to share more photos than the other True Color categories. Additionally, our results show that people with Open personality types tend to post more photos than other Big Five personality types, and those photos tend to have more people in them than other personality types.
papers.abstract_zh: 一个人选择在社交媒体上分享的内容很能说明他的个性。一个人可以通过发多少照片，发什么样的照片，倾向于用什么样的语言来展现自己的个性。这项研究调查了一个人的性格类型与他发布的照片和推文之间的相关性。社交媒体信息和性格类型是从两个不同的平台收集的，SONA(大学生)和MTurk(众包平台)。对两个平台进行了相同的调查。参与者回答了与他们的性格有关的问题，并根据这些答案给五个大项分配了真实的颜色和分数。我们的结果显示，认同绿色真彩色自我图式的人比其他真彩色类别的人倾向于分享更多的照片。此外，我们的结果显示，与其他五大人格类型相比，开放人格类型的人倾向于发布更多照片，这些照片往往比其他人格类型的人更多。
papers.title_zh: 社交媒体帖子和照片的个性

papers.title: Email Summarization to Assist Users in Phishing Identification
papers.authors: Amir Kashapov, Tingmin Wu, Sharif Abuadbba, Carsten Rudolph
papers.abstract: Cyber-phishing attacks recently became more precise, targeted, and tailored by training data to activate only in the presence of specific information or cues. They are adaptable to a much greater extent than traditional phishing detection. Hence, automated detection systems cannot always be 100% accurate, increasing the uncertainty around expected behavior when faced with a potential phishing email. On the other hand, human-centric defence approaches focus extensively on user training but face the difficulty of keeping users up to date with continuously emerging patterns. Therefore, advances in analyzing the content of an email in novel ways along with summarizing the most pertinent content to the recipients of emails is a prospective gateway to furthering how to combat these threats. Addressing this gap, this work leverages transformer-based machine learning to (i) analyze prospective psychological triggers, to (ii) detect possible malicious intent, and to (iii) create representative summaries of emails. We then amalgamate this information and present it to the user to allow them to (i) easily decide whether the email is "phishy" and (ii) self-learn advanced malicious patterns.
papers.abstract_zh: 最近，网络钓鱼攻击变得更加精确，更有针对性，并且通过训练数据来定制，以便仅在特定信息或线索出现时激活。它们比传统的网络钓鱼检测具有更大的适应性。因此，自动检测系统不可能总是100%准确，这增加了面对潜在网络钓鱼电子邮件时预期行为的不确定性。另一方面，以人为中心的防御方法广泛关注用户培训，但面临着让用户跟上不断出现的模式的困难。因此，在以新颖的方式分析电子邮件的内容以及向电子邮件的接收者总结最相关的内容方面的进步是进一步如何对抗这些威胁的前景网关。为了解决这一差距，这项工作利用基于transformer的机器学习来(I)分析预期的心理触发因素，(ii)检测可能的恶意意图，以及(iii)创建电子邮件的代表性摘要。然后，我们合并这些信息并呈现给用户，让他们(I)轻松判断电子邮件是否是“网络钓鱼邮件”,以及(ii)自学高级恶意模式。
papers.title_zh: 电子邮件摘要以帮助用户网络钓鱼识别

papers.title: Enabling Attribute-Based Access Control in Linux Kernel
papers.authors: H. O. Sai Varshith, Shamik Sural, Jaideep Vaidya, Vijayalakshmi Atluri
papers.abstract: Linux has built-in security features based on discretionary access control that can be enhanced using the Linux Security Module (LSM) framework. However, so far there has been no reported work on strengthening Linux with Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC), which is gaining in popularity in recent years due to its flexibility and dynamic nature. In this paper, a method for enabling ABAC for Linux file system objects using LSM is proposed. We report initial experimental results and also share our public repository links for integrating ABAC in any Linux installation.
papers.abstract_zh: Linux具有基于自主访问控制的内置安全特性，可以使用Linux安全模块(LSM)框架来增强这些特性。然而，到目前为止，还没有关于使用基于属性的访问控制(ABAC)来增强Linux的工作的报道，基于属性的访问控制由于其灵活性和动态性，近年来越来越受欢迎。提出了一种使用LSM为Linux文件系统对象启用ABAC的方法。我们报告了初步的实验结果，并分享了我们的公共库链接，用于在任何Linux安装中集成ABAC。
papers.title_zh: 在Linux内核中启用基于属性的访问控制

papers.title: Leveraging Spectral Representations of Control Flow Graphs for Efficient Analysis of Windows Malware
papers.authors: Qirui Sun, Eldor Abdukhamidov, Tamer Abuhmed, Mohammed Abuhamad
papers.abstract: The rapid pace of malware development and the widespread use of code obfuscation, polymorphism, and morphing techniques pose a considerable challenge to detecting and analyzing malware. Today, it is difficult for antivirus applications to use traditional signature-based detection methods to detect morphing malware. Thus, the emergence of structure graph-based detection methods has become a hope to solve this challenge. In this work, we propose a method for detecting malware using graphs' spectral heat and wave signatures, which are efficient and size- and permutation-invariant. We extracted 250 and 1,000 heat and wave representations, and we trained and tested heat and wave representations on eight machine learning classifiers. We used a dataset of 37,537 unpacked Windows malware executables and extracted the control flow graph (CFG) of each windows malware to obtain the spectral representations. Our experimental results showed that by using heat and wave spectral graph theory, the best malware analysis accuracy reached 95.9%.
papers.abstract_zh: 恶意软件开发的快速步伐以及代码混淆、多态性和变形技术的广泛使用给检测和分析恶意软件带来了相当大的挑战。今天，反病毒应用程序很难使用传统的基于签名的检测方法来检测变形恶意软件。因此，基于结构图的检测方法的出现成为了解决这一挑战的希望。在本文中，我们提出了一种利用图的谱热和波形特征来检测恶意软件的方法，这种方法是有效的，并且是大小和排列不变的。我们提取了250个和1000个热和波表示，并在八个机器学习分类器上训练和测试了热和波表示。我们使用37，537个未打包的windows恶意软件可执行文件的数据集，并提取每个Windows恶意软件的控制流图(CFG)来获得频谱表示。实验结果表明，利用热和波谱图理论，恶意软件分析准确率最高可达95.9%。
papers.title_zh: 利用控制流程图的光谱表示，以有效地分析Windows恶意软件

papers.title: TTP-Aided Secure Computation using Secret Sharing With Only One Computing Server
papers.authors: Keiichi Iwamura, Ahmad Akmal Aminuddin Mohd Kamal, Masaki Inamura
papers.abstract: Secure computation methods include methods that use homomorphic encryption (HE) and those that use secret sharing (SS). Secure computation based on HE can be realized using one server, and the computation process can be made public if the encryption key is kept secure. However, HE generally requires a substantial computation cost. In contrast, SS has the advantage of low computation cost, allowing for high-speed processing; however, all servers must be managed independently. And the process of k or more servers cannot be disclosed. In particular, secret input will be leaked when the same organization manages multiple servers to implement SS. Therefore, a complex model where each server is independently managed is required. Iwamura et al. proposed a secure computation that is information-theoretic secure in n≥k instead of n≥2k−1 by assuming a trusted third party (TTP). In this paper, by making more effective use of a TTP, we demonstrate that secure computation based on SS is possible with only one computing server. Moreover, we show that the entire computation process can be disclosed if the key is managed safely. We realize a method that solves the disadvantages of conventional approaches with a faster computation than those methods.
papers.abstract_zh: 安全计算方法包括使用同态加密(HE)和使用秘密共享(SS)的方法。基于HE的安全计算可以使用一个服务器来实现，并且如果加密密钥保持安全，则计算过程可以公开。然而，他通常需要大量的计算成本。相比之下，SS具有计算成本低的优点，允许高速处理；但是，所有服务器都必须独立管理。并且k个或更多服务器的进程不能被公开。特别是，当同一个组织管理多个服务器来实现SS时，秘密输入会被泄露。因此，需要一个复杂的模型，其中每台服务器都是独立管理的。Iwamura等人提出了一种安全计算，通过假设可信第三方(TTP ),该计算在n≥k而不是n≥2k-1时是信息论安全的。在本文中，通过更有效地利用TTP，我们证明了在只有一台计算服务器的情况下，基于SS的安全计算是可能的。此外，我们证明了如果安全地管理密钥，整个计算过程可以被公开。我们实现了一种方法，该方法解决了传统方法的缺点，具有比那些方法更快的计算速度。
papers.title_zh: 使用秘密共享仅与一台计算服务器一起使用秘密共享的TTP ADED安全计算

papers.title: Towards Polyvalent Adversarial Attacks on URL Classification Engines
papers.authors: Fabien Charmet, Harry Chandra Tanuwidjaja, Tomohiro Morikawa, Takeshi Takahashi
papers.abstract: Clicking on the wrong link and downloading a malware or leaking confidential information has been a common threat to everyone. Novel defense mechanisms against web threats have emerged, from URL parsing via Machine Learning to JavaScript deep graph analysis. In this study, we consider the problem of generating Adversarial Examples to evade URL classifiers. We propose a neural network architecture that will be able to generate synthetic URLs for a variety of attacks that will evade existing security classifiers. The main focus of the literature is on classifiers for phishing URLs, but in this work we aim to extend it to other attacks like Drive-by-Download. Our system splits the URL at the word level before substituting words with symbols. This approach contrasts with the existing literature that works on the character level without semantic considerations. We also envision a combination of the word level generation with a character level analysis by a Convolutional Neural Network to improve the evasion capacity of the synthetic samples.
papers.abstract_zh: 点击错误的链接并下载恶意软件或泄露机密信息已经成为每个人的共同威胁。针对网络威胁的新型防御机制已经出现，从通过机器学习解析URL到JavaScript深度图分析。在这项研究中，我们考虑的问题，产生对立的例子，以逃避网址分类器。我们提出了一种神经网络架构，它将能够为各种攻击生成合成URL，这些攻击将避开现有的安全分类器。文献的主要焦点是钓鱼网址的分类器，但在这项工作中，我们的目标是将其扩展到其他攻击，如下载驱动。在用符号替换单词之前，我们的系统在单词级别拆分URL。这种方法与现有的不考虑语义而在字符层面上工作的文献形成对比。我们还设想通过卷积神经网络将单词级生成与字符级分析相结合，以提高合成样本的逃避能力。
papers.title_zh: 朝着对URL分类引擎的多价对抗攻击

papers.title: Decentralized Federated Learning for Internet of Things Anomaly Detection
papers.authors: Zhuotao Lian, Chunhua Su
papers.abstract: With the improvement of computing power and the development of network technology, Internet of Things (IoT) devices are widely used in many industries. But it also faces various security threats. Anomaly detection is a commonly used method, but traditional methods face shortcomings such as low accuracy. Therefore, in this paper, we introduce a decentralized federated learning method for anomaly detection, using neural networks to improve accuracy and take advantage of the characteristics of federated learning to protect local data security. The decentralized algorithm avoids the drawbacks of traditional federated learning such as the single point of failure. Finally, we conduct simulation experiments on the IoT23 dataset, which verify the performance of our system.
papers.abstract_zh: 随着计算能力的提高和网络技术的发展，物联网设备被广泛应用于许多行业。但也面临着各种安全威胁。异常检测是一种常用的方法，但传统方法存在准确率低等缺点。因此，本文引入一种分散式联邦学习方法进行异常检测，利用神经网络提高准确率，并利用联邦学习的特点保护本地数据安全。分散算法避免了传统联邦学习的缺点，如单点故障。最后，在IoT23数据集上进行仿真实验，验证了系统的性能。
papers.title_zh: 分散的物联网异常检测的联合学习

papers.title: Autonomous Network Defence using Reinforcement Learning
papers.authors: Myles Foley, Chris Hicks, Kate Highnam, Vasilios Mavroudis
papers.abstract: In the network security arms race, the defender is significantly disadvantaged as they need to successfully detect and counter every malicious attack. In contrast, the attacker needs to succeed only once. To level the playing field, we investigate the effectiveness of autonomous agents in a realistic network defence scenario. We first outline the problem, provide the background on reinforcement learning and detail our proposed agent design. Using a network environment simulation, with 13 hosts spanning 3 subnets, we train a novel reinforcement learning agent and show that it can reliably defend continual attacks by two advanced persistent threat (APT) red agents: one with complete knowledge of the network layout and another which must discover resources through exploration but is more general.
papers.abstract_zh: 在网络安全军备竞赛中，防御方处于非常不利的地位，因为他们需要成功地检测和反击每一次恶意攻击。相比之下，攻击者只需要成功一次。为了公平竞争，我们研究了自主代理在现实网络防御场景中的有效性。我们首先概述了这个问题，提供了强化学习的背景，并详细介绍了我们提出的代理设计。使用跨越3个子网的13台主机的网络环境模拟，我们训练了一个新的强化学习代理，并表明它可以可靠地防御两个高级持久威胁(APT) red代理的连续攻击:一个具有网络布局的完整知识，另一个必须通过探索发现资源，但更通用。
papers.title_zh: 使用强化学习的自动网络防御

papers.title: Developing Secured Android Applications by Mitigating Code Vulnerabilities with Machine Learning
papers.authors: Janaka Senanayake, Harsha K. Kalutarage, M. Omar Al-Kadri, Andrei V. Petrovski, Luca Piras
papers.abstract: Mobile application developers sometimes might not be serious about source code security and publish apps to the marketplaces. Therefore, it is essential to have a fully automated security solutions generator to integrate security-by-design into the development practices, especially for the Android platform. This research proposes a Machine Learning (ML) based highly accurate method to detect Android source code vulnerabilities. A new labelled dataset containing Android source code vulnerability samples was generated initially. The dataset was used to train binary and multi-class classification based ML models, to identify code issues by following a static analysis approach. The proposed model can detect code vulnerabilities with a 0.90 F1-Score and vulnerability categories (CWE) with a 0.96 F1-Score. By integrating this with the Android development environment, app developers can analyse source code and identify security vulnerabilities in real-time. The proposed framework can be extended to suggest suitable patches to overcome the source code issues by providing real-time fixes in future.
papers.abstract_zh: 移动应用程序开发人员有时可能不重视源代码安全，将应用程序发布到市场上。因此，有一个完全自动化的安全解决方案生成器来将安全性设计集成到开发实践中是非常必要的，尤其是对于Android平台。本研究提出了一种基于机器学习的高精度Android源代码漏洞检测方法。最初生成了包含Android源代码漏洞样本的新标记数据集。该数据集用于训练基于二元和多类分类的ML模型，以通过遵循静态分析方法来识别代码问题。所提出的模型可以检测F1值为0.90的代码漏洞和F1值为0.96的漏洞类别(CWE)。通过将其与Android开发环境集成，应用程序开发人员可以分析源代码并实时识别安全漏洞。所提出的框架可以被扩展以建议合适的补丁，从而通过在将来提供实时修复来克服源代码问题。
papers.title_zh: 通过通过机器学习来减轻代码漏洞来开发安全的Android应用程序

papers.title: Decentralized and Collaborative Tracing for Group Signatures
papers.authors: Maharage Nisansala Sevwandi Perera, Toru Nakamura, Masayuki Hashimoto, Hiroyuki Yokoyama, Chen-Mou Cheng, Kouichi Sakurai
papers.abstract: We propose a decentralized but collaborative attribute-based tracing mechanism (a signer-identifying mechanism) for group signatures. Instead of a central tracing party in our scheme, a set of tracers satisfying the attribute set used for generating the group signature can identify the signer. Thus our proposal limits the parties who can identify the signer. On the other hand, it decentralized the tracing authority.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们提出了一个分散但协作的基于属性的群签名追踪机制(签名者识别机制)。在我们的方案中，一组满足用于生成群签名的属性集的追踪者可以识别签名者，而不是中心追踪方。因此，我们的提议限制了能够识别签名者的各方。另一方面，它分散了追查权。
papers.title_zh: 分散和协作的团体签名跟踪

papers.title: APKC '22: 9th ACM ASIA Public-Key Cryptography Workshop
papers.authors: Jason Paul Cruz, Naoto Yanai
papers.abstract: Public key cryptography plays an essential role in ensuring many security properties required in data processing of various kinds. The theme of this workshop is novel public-key cryptosystems for solving a wide range of real-life application problems. This workshop solicits original contributions on both applied and theoretical aspects of public-key cryptography.
papers.abstract_zh: 公钥加密在确保各种数据处理所需的许多安全属性方面起着重要作用。本次研讨会的主题是解决各种现实应用问题的新型公钥密码系统。这个工作坊在公开金钥加密的应用和理论方面寻求原创的贡献。
papers.title_zh: APKC '22：第9 ACM亚洲公共钥匙密码学研讨会

papers.title: BSCI 2022: The 4th ACM International Symposium on Blockchain and Secure Critical Infrastructure
papers.authors: Keke Gai, Kim-Kwang Raymond Choo
papers.abstract: As technology advances, critical infrastructure sectors are increasingly reliant on digital control systems and networking systems. Attacks targeting systems in critical infrastructure sectors are a matter of when and not if, as such systems are attractive to both financially motivated cyber criminals and state/politically motivated malicious actors. In this workshop, we will present findings that explore and demonstrate the various applications of blockchain in critical infrastructure sectors.
papers.abstract_zh: 随着技术进步，关键基础设施部门越来越依赖数字控制系统和网络系统。针对关键基础设施部门系统的攻击是一个时间问题，而不是是否的问题，因为这种系统对经济动机的网络犯罪分子和国家/政治动机的恶意行为者都有吸引力。在本次研讨会中，我们将展示探索和演示区块链在关键基础设施领域的各种应用的成果。
papers.title_zh: BSCI 2022：第四届ACM国际区块链和确保关键基础设施的研讨会

papers.title: CPSS '22: 8th ACM Cyber-Physical System Security Workshop
papers.authors: Alvaro A. Cárdenas, Daisuke Mashima
papers.abstract: Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS) consist of large-scale interconnected systems of heterogeneous components interacting with their physical environments. There exist a multitude of CPS devices and applications deployed to serve critical functions in our lives thus making security an important non-functional attribute of such systems. CPSS'22 workshop will provide a platform for professionals from academia, government, and industry to discuss novel ways to address the ever-present security and privacy challenges in CPS.
papers.abstract_zh: 信息物理系统(CPS)由与物理环境交互的异构组件的大规模互联系统组成。存在大量的CPS设备和应用程序被部署来服务于我们生活中的关键功能，从而使得安全性成为这种系统的重要非功能属性。CPSS的22研讨会将为来自学术界、政府和行业的专业人士提供一个平台，讨论解决CPS中始终存在的安全和隐私挑战的新方法。
papers.title_zh: CPSS '22：第8 ACM网络物理系统安全研讨会

papers.title: CySSS '22: 1st International Workshop on Cybersecurity and Social Sciences
papers.authors: Eric Chan-Tin, Shelia Kennison
papers.abstract: Cybersecurity is an interdisciplinary field, involving computer science, psychology, social science, behavioral science, criminal justice, political science, and many others. This workshop is to bring researchers from different disciplines especially cybersecurity and social sciences to discuss emerging problems at the intersection of these two areas. The goals of the workshop are to 1) advance the field of cybersecurity and 2) explore research at the intersection of cybersecurity and social/behavioral sciences.
papers.abstract_zh: 网络安全是一个跨学科领域，涉及计算机科学、心理学、社会科学、行为科学、刑事司法、政治学和许多其他学科。本次研讨会旨在召集来自不同学科(尤其是网络安全和社会科学)的研究人员讨论这两个领域的交叉问题。研讨会的目标是1)推进网络安全领域，2)探索网络安全和社会/行为科学的交叉研究。
papers.title_zh: CYSSS '22：第一国际网络安全与社会科学研讨会

papers.title: WDC'22: 1st Workshop on the Security Implications of Deepfakes and Cheapfakes
papers.authors: Simon S. Woo, Shahroz Tariq, Hyoungshick Kim
papers.abstract: The development of techniques for creating completely synthetic photographic images and videos, as well as the increasing prevalence of disinformation associated with such synthetic media, have sparked interest in the computer community. One such issue is the proliferation of deepfakes. However, much of the research is devoted to outwitting the SOTA in order to generate and detect fabricated images and video. Considering them from the perspective of computer security and human ethics is largely ignored. As such, this workshop aims to provide a forum for researchers to exchange ideas and methodologies, as well as to provide academia and industry with insights into the development and identification of fake media from a computer security perspective.
papers.abstract_zh: 创建完全合成的照片图像和视频的技术的发展，以及与这种合成媒体相关的虚假信息的日益流行，激发了计算机界的兴趣。其中一个问题就是deepfakes的泛滥。然而，许多研究都致力于智胜SOTA，以生成和检测伪造的图像和视频。从计算机安全和人类伦理的角度来考虑它们在很大程度上被忽略了。因此，本次研讨会旨在为研究人员提供一个交流思想和方法的论坛，并从计算机安全的角度为学术界和工业界提供关于假媒体开发和识别的见解。
papers.title_zh: WDC'22：关于深击和廉价摄影的安全含义的第一届研讨会

papers.title: WoRMA '22: 1st Workshop on Robust Malware Analysis
papers.authors: Fabio Pierazzi, Nedim Srndic
papers.abstract: Malware is a term used for computer software created for malicious purposes. The rise of malware has closely followed the rise of computers in the society, and in~2022 it represents a ubiquitous threat in the digital world, impacting individuals, organizations and governments. As a reaction to the emergence of malware, the new research direction malware analysis was established. Unlike most other domains of computer science, malware analysis operates in an actively adversarial environment, where the potential reward for attackers is very high, and their maneuvering space is ample. Under such conditions, an arms race has arisen between attackers and defenders. A crucial condition necessary to prevail in this race is the research of robust methods and solutions. The goal of this workshop is to bring together leading researchers in the field in a joint forum for advancing the robustness of malware analysis.
papers.abstract_zh: 恶意软件是一个术语，指出于恶意目的而创建的计算机软件。恶意软件的兴起紧随计算机在社会中的兴起，在2022年左右，它代表了数字世界中无处不在的威胁，影响着个人、组织和政府。作为对恶意软件出现的反应，建立了新的研究方向恶意软件分析。与计算机科学的大多数其他领域不同，恶意软件分析在一个积极对抗的环境中运行，攻击者的潜在回报非常高，他们的机动空间很大。在这种情况下，攻击者和防御者之间出现了军备竞赛。要在这场竞赛中获胜，一个至关重要的条件是研究强有力的方法和解决方案。本次研讨会的目标是将该领域的领先研究人员聚集在一个联合论坛上，以推进恶意软件分析的稳健性。
papers.title_zh: Worma '22：关于强大恶意软件分析的第一届研讨会

papers.title: AI and Security: Lessons, Challenges and Future Directions
papers.authors: Dawn Song
papers.abstract: In this talk, I will talk about challenges and exciting new opportunities at the intersection of AI and Security, how AI and deep learning can enable better security, and how Security can enable better AI. In particular, I will talk about secure deep learning and challenges and approaches to ensure the integrity of decisions made by deep learning. I will also give an overview on challenges and new techniques to enable privacy-preserving machine learning. Finally, I will conclude with future directions at the intersection of AI and Security. Bio:Dawn Song is a Professor in the Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at UC Berkeley. Her research interest lies in AI and deep learning, security and privacy. She is the recipient of various awards including the MacArthur Fellowship, the Guggenheim Fellowship, the NSF CAREER Award, the Alfred P. Sloan Research Fellowship, the MIT Technology Review TR-35 Award, a number of Test-of-Times Awards and Best Paper Awards from top conferences in Computer Security and Deep Learning. She is an ACM Fellow and an IEEE Fellow. She is also a serial entrepreneur and has been named on the Female Founder 100 List by Inc.
papers.abstract_zh: 在这次演讲中，我将谈论人工智能和安全交叉领域的挑战和令人兴奋的新机遇，人工智能和深度学习如何实现更好的安全，以及安全如何实现更好的人工智能。特别是，我将谈论安全的深度学习以及确保深度学习所做决策的完整性的挑战和方法。我还将概述实现隐私保护机器学习的挑战和新技术。最后，我将总结一下人工智能和安全的未来发展方向。简介:Dawn Song是加州大学伯克利分校电子工程和计算机科学系的教授。她的研究兴趣在于人工智能和深度学习、安全和隐私。她获得了各种奖项，包括MacArthur Fellowship、Guggenheim Fellowship、NSF CAREER Award、阿尔弗雷德·P·斯隆研究奖学金、MIT Technology Review TR-35 Award、许多时间考验奖和计算机安全和深度学习顶级会议的最佳论文奖。她是美国计算机学会会员和乔春明。她还是一名连续创业者，并被Inc .列入女性创始人100名名单。
papers.title_zh: AI和安全：教训，挑战和未来的方向

papers.title: Proofs or Remote Execution and Mitigation of TOCTOU Attacks
papers.authors: Gene Tsudik
papers.abstract: PART I: Modern society is increasingly surrounded by, and relies upon, a wide range of Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS), Internet-of-Things (IoT), and smart devices. They often perform safety-critical functions in numerous settings, e.g., home, office, medical, automotive and industrial. Some devices are small, cheap and specialized sensors and/or actuators. They tend to have meager resources, run simple software, sometimes upon bare metal. If such devices are left unprotected, consequences of forged sensor readings or ignored actuation commands can be catastrophic, particularly, in safety-critical settings. This prompts the following three questions: (1) How to trust data produced by a simple remote embedded device? (2) How to ascertain that this data was produced via execution of expected software? And, (3) Is it possible to attain (1) and (2) under the assumption that all software on the remote device could be modified or compromised? In the first part of the talk we answer these questions by describing VAPE: Verified Architecture for Proofs of Execution [1], the first of its kind result for low-end embedded systems. This work has a range of applications, especially, to authenticated sensing and trustworthy actuation, which are increasingly relevant in the context of safety-critical systems. VAPE architecture is publicly available and it incurs low overhead, affordable even for lowest-end embedded devices. PART II: Much attention has been devoted to verifying software integrity of remote embedded (IoT) devices. Many techniques, with different assumptions and security guarantees, have been proposed under the common umbrella of so-called Remote Attestation (RA). Aside from software integrity verification and malware presence detection, RA serves as a foundation for many security services, such as proofs of memory erasure, system reset, software update, and runtime verification. All prior RA techniques verify the remote device's state at the time when RA functionality is executed, thus providing no information about the device's state before current RA execution or between consecutive RA executions. This implies that presence of transient malware may be undetected. In other words, if transient malware infects a device, performs its nefarious tasks, and leaves before the next attestation, its temporary presence will not be detected. This important problem, called Time-Of-Check-Time-Of-Use (TOCTOU), is well-known in the research literature and remains unaddressed in the context of RA. In the second part of this talk, we discuss Remote Attestation with TOCTOU Avoidance (RATA): a provably secure approach to address the RA TOCTOU problem [2]. With RATA, even malware that erases itself before the next RA execution, cannot hide its ephemeral presence. RATA targets hybrid RA architectures aimed at low-end embedded devices. It comes in two version: RATA-A and RATA-B, suitable for devices with and without real-time clocks, respectively. Each is shown to be secure and is accompanied by a publicly available and formally verified implementation. Both techniques incur rather low hardware overhead, and it, in fact, substantially reduces computational costs of RA execution.
papers.abstract_zh: 第一部分:现代社会日益被广泛的网络物理系统(CPS)、物联网(IoT)和智能设备所包围和依赖。它们通常在许多环境中执行安全关键功能，例如家庭、办公室、医疗、汽车和工业。一些设备是小型、廉价和专用的传感器和/或致动器。他们往往资源匮乏，运行简单的软件，有时是在裸机上运行。如果这种装置不受保护，伪造的传感器读数或忽略驱动命令的后果可能是灾难性的，特别是在安全关键的设置中。这就提示了以下三个问题:(1)如何信任一个简单的远程嵌入式设备产生的数据？(2)如何确定这些数据是通过执行预期的软件产生的？以及(3)在假设远程设备上的所有软件都可能被修改或危害的情况下，是否有可能实现(1)和(2)？在演讲的第一部分，我们通过描述VAPE来回答这些问题:执行证明的验证架构[1]，这是低端嵌入式系统的首个同类成果。这项工作有广泛的应用，特别是认证传感和可信驱动，这在安全关键系统的背景下越来越重要。VAPE体系结构是公开可用的，它的开销很低，即使是最低端的嵌入式设备也能负担得起。第二部分:验证远程嵌入式(IoT)设备的软件完整性受到了广泛关注。在所谓的远程证明(RA)的共同保护伞下，已经提出了许多具有不同假设和安全保证的技术。除了软件完整性验证和恶意软件存在检测，RA还是许多安全服务的基础，如内存擦除证明、系统重置、软件更新和运行时验证。所有现有的RA技术在执行RA功能时验证远程设备的状态，因此在当前RA执行之前或在连续RA执行之间不提供关于设备状态的信息。这意味着暂时恶意软件的存在可能未被检测到。换句话说，如果暂时性恶意软件感染了设备，执行了其邪恶的任务，并在下一次证明之前离开，其暂时存在将不会被检测到。这个重要的问题，称为检查时间使用时间(TOCTOU)，在研究文献中是众所周知的，在RA的背景下仍然没有解决。在本次演讲的第二部分，我们将讨论远程证明与规避风险(RATA):一种可证明安全的解决规避风险问题的方法[2]。有了RATA，即使恶意软件在下一次RA执行前删除了自己，也无法隐藏它短暂的存在。RATA的目标是针对低端嵌入式设备的混合RA架构。它有两个版本:RATA-A和RATA-B，分别适用于带和不带实时时钟的设备。每个都被证明是安全的，并附有一个公开可用的和正式验证的实现。这两种技术的硬件开销都很低，并且实际上大大降低了RA执行的计算成本。
papers.title_zh: 证明或远程执行以及减轻TOCTOU攻击

papers.title: Global Communication Guarantees in the Presence of Adversaries
papers.authors: Adrian Perrig
papers.abstract: DDoS attacks have been plaguing the Internet for over 20 years. For every defense mechanism invented, attackers find a new way to circumvent it. Is it possible to fundamentally prevent DDoS attacks and achieve global communication guarantees? Since the Internet is a public resource, what does it even mean to prevent DDoS -- since the adversary can also claim to be communicating "legitimately". In this talk we will unravel the different forms of DDoS attacks by first discussing how to construct meaningful definitions, and second showing how to achieve communication guarantees. This talk then demonstrates how global communication guarantees can be achieved in the SCION secure Internet architecture.
papers.abstract_zh: DDoS攻击已经困扰互联网20多年了。对于发明的每一种防御机制，攻击者都会找到新的方法来规避它。有没有可能从根本上防止DDoS攻击，实现全球通信保障？既然互联网是公共资源，那么阻止DDoS又意味着什么呢——因为对手也可以声称在“合法地”通信。在本次演讲中，我们将首先讨论如何构建有意义的定义，然后展示如何实现通信保障，从而揭示不同形式的DDoS攻击。本讲座将展示如何在SCION安全互联网架构中实现全球通信保障。
papers.title_zh: 在对手的存在下，全球沟通保证

papers.title: The Lazarus Effect: Healing Compromised Devices in the Internet of Small Things
papers.authors: Manuel Huber, Stefan Hristozov, Simon Ott, Vasil Sarafov, Marcus Peinado
papers.abstract: We live in a time when billions of IoT devices are being deployed and increasingly relied upon. This makes ensuring their availability and recoverability in case of a compromise a paramount goal. The large and rapidly growing number of deployed IoT devices make manual recovery impractical, especially if the devices are dispersed over a large area. Thus, there is a need for a reliable and scalable remote recovery mechanism that works even after attackers have taken full control over devices, possibly misusing them or trying to render them useless. To tackle this problem, we present Lazarus, a system that enables the remote recovery of compromised IoT devices. With Lazarus, an IoT administrator can remotely control the code running on IoT devices unconditionally and within a guaranteed time bound. This makes recovery possible even in case of severe corruption of the devices' software stack. We impose only minimal hardware requirements, making Lazarus applicable even for low-end constrained off-the-shelf IoT devices. We isolate Lazarus's minimal recovery trusted computing base from untrusted software both in time and by using a trusted execution environment. The temporal isolation prevents secrets from being leaked through side-channels to untrusted software. Inside the trusted execution environment, we place minimal functionality that constrains untrusted software at runtime. We implement Lazarus on an ARM Cortex-M33-based microcontroller in a full setup with an IoT hub, device provisioning and secure update functionality. Our prototype can recover compromised embedded OSs and bare-metal applications and prevents attackers from bricking devices, for example, through flash wear out. We show this at the example of FreeRTOS, which requires no modifications but only a single additional task. Our evaluation shows negligible runtime performance impact and moderate memory requirements.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们生活在一个数十亿的物联网设备正在被部署并越来越依赖的时代。这使得确保它们在遭到破坏时的可用性和可恢复性成为首要目标。部署的物联网设备数量庞大且快速增长，这使得手动恢复变得不切实际，尤其是在设备分散在很大区域的情况下。因此，需要一种可靠且可扩展的远程恢复机制，即使在攻击者完全控制了设备，可能误用它们或试图使它们无用之后，该机制也能工作。为了解决这个问题，我们提出了Lazarus，这是一个能够远程恢复受损物联网设备的系统。借助Lazarus，物联网管理员可以在有保证的时间范围内无条件地远程控制运行在物联网设备上的代码。这使得即使在设备软件堆栈严重损坏的情况下也可以进行恢复。我们只提出最低的硬件要求，使Lazarus甚至适用于低端受限的现成物联网设备。我们通过使用可信执行环境，及时将Lazarus的最小恢复可信计算基础与不可信软件隔离开来。暂时隔离防止秘密通过旁道泄露给不可信的软件。在可信执行环境中，我们放置了在运行时约束不可信软件的最小功能。我们在基于ARM Cortex-M33的微控制器上实施了Lazarus，该微控制器具有物联网中心、设备供应和安全更新功能。我们的原型可以恢复受损的嵌入式操作系统和裸机应用，并防止攻击者通过闪存磨损等方式破坏设备。我们以FreeRTOS为例展示了这一点，它不需要修改，只需要一个额外的任务。我们的评估显示，运行时性能影响可以忽略不计，内存需求适中。
papers.title_zh: Lazarus效应：在小东西的互联网中治愈的设备损害

papers.title: AuthCTC: Defending Against Waveform Emulation Attack in Heterogeneous IoT Environments
papers.authors: Sihan Yu, Xiaonan Zhang, Pei Huang, Linke Guo, Long Cheng, Kuang-Ching Wang
papers.abstract: Widely deployed IoT devices have raised serious concerns for the spectrum shortage and the cost of multi-protocol gateway deployment. Recent emerging Cross-Technology Communication (CTC) technique can alleviate this issue by enabling direct communication among heterogeneous wireless devices, such as WiFi, Bluetooth, and ZigBee on 2.4 GHz. However, this new paradigm also brings security risks, where an attacker can use CTC to launch wireless attacks against IoT devices. Due to limited computational capability and different wireless protocols being used, many IoT devices are unable to use computationally-intensive cryptographic approaches for security enhancement. Therefore, without proper detection methods, IoT devices cannot distinguish signal sources before executing command signals. In this paper, we first demonstrate a new defined physical layer attack in the CTC scenario, named as waveform emulation attack, where a WiFi device can overhear and emulate the ZigBee waveform to attack ZigBee IoT devices. Then, to defend against this new attack, we propose a physical layer defensive mechanism, named as AuthCTC, to verify the legitimacy of CTC signals. Specifically, at the sender side, an authorization code is embedded into the packet preamble by leveraging the dynamically changed cyclic prefix. A WiFi-based detector is used to verify the authorization code at the receiver side. Extensive simulations and experiments using off-the-shelf devices are conducted to demonstrate both the feasibility of the attack and the effectiveness of our defensive mechanism.
papers.abstract_zh: 广泛部署的物联网设备引起了对频谱短缺和多协议网关部署成本的严重关注。最近新兴的跨技术通信(CTC)技术可以通过实现异构无线设备之间的直接通信来缓解这个问题，例如2.4 GHz上的WiFi、蓝牙和ZigBee。然而，这种新范式也带来了安全风险，攻击者可以利用CTC对物联网设备发起无线攻击。由于有限的计算能力和使用的不同无线协议，许多物联网设备无法使用计算密集型加密方法来增强安全性。因此，如果没有适当的检测方法，物联网设备在执行命令信号之前无法区分信号源。在本文中，我们首先演示了一种新定义的CTC场景中的物理层攻击，称为波形仿真攻击，其中WiFi设备可以偷听并仿真ZigBee波形来攻击ZigBee物联网设备。然后，为了防御这种新的攻击，我们提出了一种物理层防御机制AuthCTC来验证CTC信号的合法性。具体地，在发送方，通过利用动态改变的循环前缀，授权码被嵌入到分组前导中。基于WiFi的检测器用于在接收器侧验证授权码。使用现成的设备进行了广泛的模拟和实验，以证明攻击的可行性和我们的防御机制的有效性。
papers.title_zh: AUTHCTC：防御异质IoT环境中的波形仿真攻击

papers.title: DeepPower: Non-intrusive and Deep Learning-based Detection of IoT Malware Using Power Side Channels
papers.authors: Fei Ding, Hongda Li, Feng Luo, Hongxin Hu, Long Cheng, Hai Xiao, Rong Ge
papers.abstract: The vulnerability of Internet of Things (IoT) devices to malware attacks poses huge challenges to current Internet security. The IoT malware attacks are usually composed of three stages: intrusion, infection and monetization. Existing approaches for IoT malware detection cannot effectively identify the executed malicious activities at intrusion and infection stages, and thus cannot help stop potential attacks timely. In this paper, we present DeepPower, a non-intrusive approach to infer malicious activities of IoT malware via analyzing power side-channel signals using deep learning. DeepPower first filters raw power signals of IoT devices to obtain suspicious signals, and then performs a fine-grained analysis on these signals to infer corresponding executed activities inside the devices. DeepPower determines whether there exists an ongoing malware infection by conducting a correlation analysis on these identified activities. We implement a prototype of DeepPower leveraging low-cost sensors and devices and evaluate the effectiveness of DeepPower against real-world IoT malware using commodity IoT devices. Our experimental results demonstrate that DeepPower is able to detect infection activities of different IoT malware with a high accuracy without any changes to the monitored devices.
papers.abstract_zh: 物联网设备易受恶意软件攻击的弱点对当前的互联网安全构成了巨大挑战。物联网恶意软件攻击通常由入侵、感染和货币化三个阶段组成。现有的物联网恶意软件检测方法无法在入侵和感染阶段有效识别已执行的恶意活动，因此无法及时阻止潜在的攻击。在本文中，我们提出了DeepPower，一种通过使用深度学习分析功率侧信道信号来推断物联网恶意软件恶意活动的非侵入性方法。DeepPower首先对物联网设备的原始电源信号进行过滤，获得可疑信号，然后对这些信号进行细粒度分析，推断出设备内部相应的执行活动。DeepPower通过对这些已识别的活动进行相关性分析来确定是否存在持续的恶意软件感染。我们实现了一个利用低成本传感器和设备的DeepPower原型，并使用商用物联网设备评估了DeepPower对抗真实世界物联网恶意软件的有效性。我们的实验结果表明，DeepPower能够以较高的准确性检测不同物联网恶意软件的感染活动，而无需对受监控的设备进行任何更改。
papers.title_zh: deeppower：使用电源侧渠道对物联网恶意软件的非侵入性和深度学习检测

papers.title: Your Smart Home Can't Keep a Secret: Towards Automated Fingerprinting of IoT Traffic
papers.authors: Shuaike Dong, Zhou Li, Di Tang, Jiongyi Chen, Menghan Sun, Kehuan Zhang
papers.abstract: The IoT (Internet of Things) technology has been widely adopted in recent years and has profoundly changed the people's daily lives. However, in the meantime, such a fast-growing technology has also introduced new privacy issues, which need to be better understood and measured. In this work, we look into how private information can be leaked from network traffic generated in the smart home network. Although researchers have proposed techniques to infer IoT device types or user behaviors under clean experiment setup, the effectiveness of such approaches become questionable in the complex but realistic network environment, where common techniques like Network Address and Port Translation (NAPT) and Virtual Private Network (VPN) are enabled. To this aim, we propose a traffic analysis framework based on sequence-learning techniques like LSTM and leveraged the temporal relations between packets for the attack of device identification. We evaluated it under different environment settings (e.g., pure-IoT and noisy environment with multiple non-IoT devices). The results showed our framework was able to differentiate device types with a high accuracy. This result suggests IoT network communications pose prominent challenges to users' privacy, even when they are protected by encryption and morphed by the network gateway. As such, new privacy protection methods on IoT traffic need to be developed towards mitigating this new issue.
papers.abstract_zh: 物联网技术近年来被广泛采用，深刻地改变了人们的日常生活。然而，与此同时，这种快速发展的技术也带来了新的隐私问题，需要更好地理解和衡量。在这项工作中，我们研究了智能家庭网络中产生的网络流量是如何泄露私人信息的。尽管研究人员已经提出了在干净的实验设置下推断物联网设备类型或用户行为的技术，但在复杂但现实的网络环境中，这种方法的有效性变得值得怀疑，在这种环境中，启用了网络地址和端口转换(NAPT)和虚拟专用网络(VPN)等常见技术。为此，我们提出了一个基于序列学习技术(如LSTM)的流量分析框架，并利用数据包之间的时间关系来攻击设备识别。我们在不同的环境设置下对其进行了评估(例如，纯物联网和带有多个非物联网设备的嘈杂环境)。结果表明，我们的框架能够以较高的准确度区分设备类型。这一结果表明，物联网网络通信对用户的隐私构成了突出的挑战，即使他们受到加密保护并被网关篡改。因此，需要开发新的物联网流量隐私保护方法来缓解这一新问题。
papers.title_zh: 您聪明的家无法保密：朝着物联网交通的自动指纹识别

papers.title: PassTag: A Graphical-Textual Hybrid Fallback Authentication System
papers.authors: Joon Kuy Han, Xiaojun Bi, Hyoungshick Kim, Simon S. Woo
papers.abstract: Designing a fallback authentication mechanism that is both memorable and strong is a challenging problem because of the trade-off between usability and security.
