In particular, OptiSwap has almost no overhead in communication complexity, and improves on the computational overheads of the parties compared to prior solutions. An additional feature of OptiSwap is a protection mechanism against so-called grieving attacks, where an adversary attempts to violate the financial fairness of the protocol by forcing the honest party to pay fees. We analyze OptiSwap's security in the UC model and provide benchmark results over Ethereum.
papers.abstract_zh: 当卖家和买家互不信任时，在互联网上安全地销售数字商品是一项具有挑战性的任务。随着加密货币的出现，数字交易的一个突出解决方案是依靠智能合同作为可信的仲裁者，在卖方和买方意见不一致时公平地解决纠纷。这种协议具有乐观模式，在这种模式下，各方之间的数字交换可以通过与智能合约的最小交互来完成。在本文中，我们提出了OptiSwap，一种新的基于智能合约的公平交换协议，它极大地改善了基于智能合约的公平交换协议的乐观情况。特别地，OptiSwap在通信复杂性方面几乎没有开销，并且与现有解决方案相比，改善了各方的计算开销。OptiSwap的另一个特性是针对所谓悲伤攻击的保护机制，在悲伤攻击中，对手试图通过强迫诚实方付费来违反协议的财务公平性。我们分析了OptiSwap在UC模型中的安全性，并提供了基于以太坊的基准测试结果。
papers.title_zh: OptisWap：快速乐观的公平交流

papers.title: BOREALIS: Building Block for Sealed Bid Auctions on Blockchains
papers.authors: Erik-Oliver Blass, Florian Kerschbaum
papers.abstract: We focus on securely computing the ranks of sealed integers distributed among n parties. For example, we securely compute the largest or smallest integer, the median, or in general the kth-ranked integer. Such computations are a useful building block to securely implement a variety of sealed-bid auctions. Our objective is efficiency, specifically low interactivity between parties to support blockchains or other scenarios where multiple rounds are time-consuming. Hence, we dismiss powerful, yet highly-interactive MPC frameworks and propose BOREALIS, a special-purpose protocol for secure computation of ranks among integers. BOREALIS uses additively homomorphic encryption to implement core comparisons, but computes under distinct keys, chosen by each party to optimize the number of rounds. By carefully combining cryptographic primitives, such as ECC Elgamal encryption, encrypted comparisons, ciphertext blinding, secret sharing, and shuffling, BOREALIS sets up systems of multi-scalar equations which we efficiently prove with Groth-Sahai ZK proofs. Therewith, BOREALIS implements a multi-party computation of pairwise comparisons and rank zero-knowledge proofs secure against malicious adversaries. BOREALIS completes in at most 4 rounds which is constant in both bit length l of integers and the number of parties n. This is not only asymptotically optimal, but surpasses generic constant-round secure multi-party computation protocols, even those based on shared-key fully homomorphic encryption. Furthermore, our implementation shows that BOREALIS is very practical. Its main bottleneck, ZK proof computations, is small in practice. Even for a large number of parties (n=200) and high-precision integers (l=32), computation time of all proofs is less than a single Bitcoin block interval.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们关注于安全地计算分布在n方的密封整数的秩。例如，我们安全地计算最大或最小的整数、中值，或者通常是第k个排序的整数。这种计算是安全实现各种密封投标拍卖的有用构件。我们的目标是效率，特别是各方之间的低交互性，以支持区块链或其他多轮耗时的场景。因此，我们摒弃了功能强大但高度交互的MPC框架，而提出了BOREALIS，这是一种用于安全计算整数排序的专用协议。BOREALIS使用附加同态加密来实现核心比较，但在不同的密钥下进行计算，这些密钥由各方选择以优化回合数。通过仔细组合密码原语，如ECC Elgamal加密、加密比较、密文盲化、秘密共享和洗牌，BOREALIS建立了多标量方程组，我们用Groth-Sahai ZK证明有效地证明了该方程组。由此，BOREALIS实现了成对比较的多方计算，并对针对恶意对手的零知识证明进行排序。BOREALIS在至多4轮中完成，这在整数的比特长度l和参与方的数量n方面是恒定的。这不仅是渐近最优的，而且超过了一般的恒定轮安全多方计算协议，甚至那些基于共享密钥完全同态加密的协议。此外，我们的实现表明BOREALIS是非常实用的。它的主要瓶颈，ZK证明计算，实际上很小。即使对于大量的当事人(n=200)和高精度整数(l=32)，所有证明的计算时间都小于单个比特币块区间。
papers.title_zh: 北方人：密封竞标拍卖的基础区块链

papers.title: Rational Manager in Bitcoin Mining Pool: Dynamic Strategies to Gain Extra Rewards
papers.authors: Feifan Yu, Na Ruan, Siyuan Cheng
papers.abstract: Participants of the Bitcoin system form mining pools, which have become the leading institutions of the Bitcoin mining economy, to smooth their reward of mining. Many attacks towards mining pools have been proposed. Block Withholding attack is an attacker splitting some of the power to mine in a pool, submitting shares while withholding blocks, which is one of the most famous and original attacks. Few pieces of research pay attention to the case that managers work rationally to gain extra rewards themselves at the same time of countering withholding attack. However, some different reward functions have been proposed to avoid rational miners' withholding. In this paper, we offer a model that a rational manager gain extra rewards and incentivize miners not to withhold blocks by applying a dynamic mining strategy. We conduct quantitive analysis and simulations to verify the availability and effectiveness of our attacks. We show the attack benefits the miners in the pool in some circumstances, and further discuss improvement for our attack.
papers.abstract_zh: 比特币系统的参与者形成了矿池，这些矿池已成为比特币采矿经济的主导机构，以平滑他们的采矿回报。已经提出了许多针对采矿池的攻击。block retaining攻击是攻击者拆分一部分权力到一个池中挖矿，提交份额的同时扣留blocks，这是最著名也是最原始的攻击之一。很少有研究关注管理者理性工作，在对抗截留攻击的同时为自己获取额外报酬的情况。然而，一些不同的奖励函数已被提出，以避免合理的矿工扣留。在本文中，我们提供了一个模型，一个理性的管理者通过应用一个动态的开采策略来获得额外的报酬和激励矿工不扣留区块。我们进行了定量分析和模拟，以验证我们的攻击的可用性和有效性。我们展示了攻击在某些情况下对池中矿工的好处，并进一步讨论了对我们攻击的改进。
papers.title_zh: 比特币采矿库中的理性经理：获得额外奖励的动态策略

papers.title: ÆGIS: Shielding Vulnerable Smart Contracts Against Attacks
papers.authors: Christof Ferreira Torres, Mathis Baden, Robert Norvill, Beltran Borja Fiz Pontiveros, Hugo Jonker, Sjouke Mauw
papers.abstract: In recent years, smart contracts have suffered major exploits, cost- ing millions of dollars. Unlike traditional programs, smart contracts are deployed on a blockchain. As such, they cannot be modified once deployed. Though various tools have been proposed to detect vulnerable smart contracts, the majority fails to protect vulnera- ble contracts that have already been deployed on the blockchain. Only very few solutions have been proposed so far to tackle the issue of post-deployment. However, these solutions suffer from low precision and are not generic enough to prevent any type of attack. In this work, we introduce ÆGIS, a dynamic analysis tool that protects smart contracts from being exploited during runtime. Its capability of detecting new vulnerabilities can easily be extended through so-called attack patterns. These patterns are written in a domain-specific language that is tailored to the execution model of Ethereum smart contracts. The language enables the description of malicious control and data flows. In addition, we propose a novel mechanism to streamline and speed up the process of managing attack patterns. Patterns are voted upon and stored via a smart contract, thus leveraging the benefits of tamper-resistance and transparency provided by the blockchain. We compare ÆGIS to current state-of-the-art tools and demonstrate that our solution achieves higher precision in detecting attacks. Finally, we perform a large-scale analysis on the first 4.5 million blocks of the Ethereum blockchain, thereby confirming the occurrences of well reported and yet unreported attacks in the wild.
papers.abstract_zh: 近年来，智能合约遭受了重大的攻击，损失了数百万美元。与传统程序不同，智能合同部署在区块链上。因此，它们一旦部署就无法修改。尽管已经提出了各种工具来检测易受攻击的智能合约，但是大多数工具都无法保护已经部署在区块链上的易受攻击的合约。迄今为止，只提出了很少的解决方案来处理部署后的问题。然而，这些解决方案精确度低，并且不够通用，无法防止任何类型的攻击。在本文中，我们介绍了一种动态分析工具？GIS，它可以保护智能合约在运行时不被利用。它检测新漏洞的能力可以通过所谓的攻击模式轻松扩展。这些模式是用特定于领域的语言编写的，这种语言是为以太坊智能合约的执行模型量身定制的。该语言能够描述恶意控制和数据流。此外，我们提出了一种新的机制来简化和加速管理攻击模式的过程。模式通过智能合约进行投票和存储，从而利用了区块链提供的防篡改和透明性的优势。我们将地理信息系统与当前最先进的工具进行了比较，并证明我们的解决方案在检测攻击方面具有更高的精度。最后，我们对以太坊区块链的前450万个数据块进行了大规模分析，从而证实了在野外发生的被广泛报道但未被报道的攻击。
papers.title_zh: GIS：屏蔽弱势智能合约免受攻击

papers.title: PathAFL: Path-Coverage Assisted Fuzzing
papers.authors: Shengbo Yan, Chenlu Wu, Hang Li, Wei Shao, Chunfu Jia
papers.abstract: Fuzzing is an effective method to find software bugs and vulnerabilities. One of the most useful techniques is the coverage-guided fuzzing, whose key element is the tracing code coverage information. Existing coverage-guided fuzzers generally use the the number of basic blocks or edges explored to measure code coverage. Path-coverage can provide more accurate coverage information than basic block and edge coverage. However, the number of paths grows exponentially as the size of a program increases. It is almost impossible to trace all the paths of a real-world application. In this paper, we propose a fuzzing solution named PathAFL, which assists a fuzzer by path identification. It can effectively identify and utilize the important h-path, which is a new path but whose edges have all been touched previously. First, PathAFL only inserts one assembly instruction to AFL's original code to calculate the path hash, and uses a selective instrumentation strategy to reduce the tracing granularity of an execution path. Second, we design a fast filtering algorithm to choose higher weight paths from a large number of h-paths and add them to the seed queue. Third, both the seed selection algorithm and the power schedule are implemented based on the path weight. Finally we implemented PathAFL based on the popular fuzzer AFL and evaluated it on 10 well-fuzzed benchmark programs. In 24 hours, PathAFL explored 38% more paths and 9.3% more edges than AFL. Compared with CollAFL-x, the number is 25% and 5.9% correspondingly. Moreover, PathAFL found the more bugs on the LAVA-M dataset, even four unlisted bugs. The results show that PathAFL outperforms the previous fuzzers in terms of both code coverage and bug discovery. In well-tested programs, PathAFL found 8 new security bugs with 6 CVEs assigned.
papers.abstract_zh: 模糊化是发现软件缺陷和漏洞的有效方法。最有用的技术之一是覆盖引导模糊化，其关键元素是跟踪代码覆盖信息。现有的覆盖导向模糊器通常使用被探索的基本块或边的数量来测量代码覆盖。路径覆盖比基本块和边覆盖能提供更准确的覆盖信息。然而，随着程序规模的增加，路径的数量呈指数增长。几乎不可能跟踪真实应用程序的所有路径。在本文中，我们提出了一个名为PathAFL的模糊解决方案，它通过路径识别来辅助模糊器。它可以有效地识别和利用重要的h路径，该h路径是新的路径，但是其边缘已经被预先接触过。首先，PathAFL仅在AFL的原始代码中插入一条汇编指令来计算路径哈希，并使用选择性插装策略来降低执行路径的跟踪粒度。其次，我们设计了一种快速过滤算法，从大量的h路径中选择权重较高的路径，并将其添加到种子队列中。第三，基于路径权重实现种子选择算法和功率调度。最后，我们基于流行的fuzzer AFL实现了PathAFL，并在10个模糊化良好的基准程序上对其进行了评估。在24小时内，PathAFL比AFL多探索了38%的路径和9.3%的边。与CollAFL-x相比，该数字分别为25%和5.9%。此外，PathAFL在LAVA-M数据集上发现了更多的bug，甚至有四个未列出的bug。结果表明，PathAFL在代码覆盖率和bug发现方面都优于以前的fuzzers。在经过充分测试的程序中，PathAFL发现了8个新的安全漏洞，分配了6个CVE。
papers.title_zh: Pathafl：路径覆盖的辅助模糊

papers.title: XSS Vulnerabilities in Cloud-Application Add-Ons
papers.authors: Thanh Bui, Siddharth Prakash Rao, Markku Antikainen, Tuomas Aura
papers.abstract: Many cloud-application vendors open their APIs for third-party developers to easily extend the functionality of their applications. The features implemented with these APIs are called add-ons (also called add-ins or apps). This is a relatively new phenomenon, and its effects on the application security have not been widely studied. It seems likely that some of the add-ons have lower code quality than the core applications themselves and, thus, may bring in security vulnerabilities. In this work, we found that many of such add-ons are vulnerable to cross-site scripting (XSS). The attacker can take advantage of the document-sharing and messaging features of the cloud applications to send malicious input to them. The vulnerable add-ons then execute client-side JavaScript from the carefully crafted malicious input. In a major analysis effort, we systematically studied 300 add-ons for three popular application suites, namely Microsoft Office Online, G Suite and Shopify, and discovered a significant percentage of vulnerable add-ons among them. We present the results of this study, as well as analyze the add-on architectures to understand how the XSS vulnerabilities can be exploited and how the threat can be mitigated.
papers.abstract_zh: 许多云应用程序供应商向第三方开发人员开放他们的API，以便轻松扩展他们应用程序的功能。用这些API实现的功能称为附加组件(也称为插件或应用程序)。这是一个相对较新的现象，它对应用程序安全性的影响还没有得到广泛的研究。一些附加组件的代码质量似乎比核心应用程序本身的代码质量低，因此可能会带来安全漏洞。在这项工作中，我们发现许多这样的附加组件容易受到跨站点脚本(XSS)的攻击。攻击者可以利用云应用程序的文档共享和消息传递功能向它们发送恶意输入。然后，易受攻击的附加组件从精心制作的恶意输入中执行客户端JavaScript。在一项主要的分析工作中，我们系统地研究了三个流行的应用程序套件(即Microsoft Office Online、G Suite和Shopify)的300个附加组件，并在其中发现了相当大比例的易受攻击的附加组件。我们将展示这项研究的结果，并分析附加架构，以了解如何利用XSS漏洞以及如何减轻威胁。
papers.title_zh: cloud-application附加组中的XSS漏洞

papers.title: The Taint Rabbit: Optimizing Generic Taint Analysis with Dynamic Fast Path Generation
papers.authors: John Galea, Daniel Kroening
papers.abstract: Generic taint analysis is a pivotal technique in software security. However, it suffers from staggeringly high overhead. In this paper, we explore the hypothesis whether just-in-time (JIT) generation of fast paths for tracking taint can enhance the performance. To this end, we present the Taint Rabbit, which supports highly customizable user-defined taint policies and combines a JIT with fast context switching. Our experimental results suggest that this combination outperforms notable existing implementations of generic taint analysis and bridges the performance gap to specialized trackers. For instance, Dytan incurs an average overhead of 237x, while the Taint Rabbit achieves 1.7x on the same set of benchmarks. This compares favorably to the 1.5x overhead delivered by the bitwise, non-generic, taint engine LibDFT.
papers.abstract_zh: 一般污点分析是软件安全中的一项关键技术。然而，它的开销高得惊人。在本文中，我们探讨了一个假设，即实时(JIT)生成跟踪污点的快速路径是否可以提高性能。为此，我们提出了Taint Rabbit，它支持高度可定制的用户定义的污点策略，并将JIT与快速上下文切换相结合。我们的实验结果表明，这种组合优于一般污点分析的现有实现，并弥合了与专用跟踪器的性能差距。例如，Dytan的平均开销是237倍，而Taint Rabbit在同一组基准测试中的平均开销是1.7倍。这与按位、非通用的污点引擎LibDFT所带来的1.5倍开销相比毫不逊色。
papers.title_zh: 污染兔子：通过动态快速路径生成优化通用污点分析

papers.title: A Comb for Decompiled C Code
papers.authors: Andrea Gussoni, Alessandro Di Federico, Pietro Fezzardi, Giovanni Agosta
papers.abstract: Decompilers are fundamental tools to perform security assessments of third-party software. The quality of decompiled code can be a game changer in order to reduce the time and effort required for analysis. This paper proposes a novel approach to restructure the control flow graph recovered from binary programs in a semantics-preserving fashion. The algorithm is designed from the ground up with the goal of producing C code that is both goto-free and drastically reducing the mental load required for an analyst to understand it. As a result, the code generated with this technique is well-structured, idiomatic, readable, easy to understand and fully exploits the expressiveness of C language. The algorithm has been implemented on top of the revng static binary analysis framework. The resulting decompiler, revngc, is compared on real-world binaries with state-of-the-art commercial and open source tools. The results show that our decompilation process introduces between 40% and 50% less extra cyclomatic complexity.
papers.abstract_zh: 反编译器是对第三方软件进行安全评估的基本工具。为了减少分析所需的时间和精力，反编译代码的质量可以改变游戏规则。提出了一种新的方法，以保持语义的方式重构从二进制程序中恢复的控制流图。该算法是从头开始设计的，其目标是生成C代码，这种代码既可以免于跳转，又可以极大地减少分析师理解它所需的精神负担。因此，使用这种技术生成的代码结构良好、符合习惯、可读性强、易于理解，并且充分利用了C语言的表现力。该算法已经在revng静态二进制分析框架上实现。生成的反编译器revngc在真实的二进制文件上与最先进的商业和开源工具进行了比较。结果表明，我们的反编译过程引入了40%到50%的额外圈复杂度。
papers.title_zh: 梳理C代码的梳子

papers.title: BOTection: Bot Detection by Building Markov Chain Models of Bots Network Behavior
papers.authors: Bushra A. AlAhmadi, Enrico Mariconti, Riccardo Spolaor, Gianluca Stringhini, Ivan Martinovic
papers.abstract: Botnets continue to be a threat to organizations, thus various machine learning-based botnet detectors have been proposed. However, the capability of such systems in detecting new or unseen botnets is crucial to ensure its robustness against the rapid evolution of botnets. Moreover, it prolongs the effectiveness of the system in detecting bots, avoiding frequent and time-consuming classifier re-training. We present BOTection, a privacy-preserving bot detection system that models the bot network flow behavior as a Markov Chain. The Markov Chain state transitions capture the bots' network behavior using high-level flow features as states, producing content-agnostic and encryption resilient behavioral features. These features are used to train a classifier to first detect flows produced by bots, and then identify their bot families. We evaluate our system on a dataset of over 7M malicious flows from 12 botnet families, showing its capability of detecting bots' network traffic with 99.78% F-measure and classifying it to a malware family with a 99.09% F-measure. Notably, due to the modeling of general bot network behavior by the Markov Chains, BOTection can detect traffic belonging to unseen bot families with an F-measure of 93.03% making it robust against malware evolution.
papers.abstract_zh: 僵尸网络继续对组织构成威胁，因此提出了各种基于机器学习的僵尸网络检测器。然而，此类系统检测新的或未发现的僵尸网络的能力对于确保其抵御僵尸网络快速演变的鲁棒性至关重要。此外，它延长了系统检测僵尸工具的有效性，避免了频繁而耗时的分类器重新训练。我们提出了BOTection，一个隐私保护的bot检测系统，它将bot网络流行为建模为马尔可夫链。马尔可夫链状态转移使用高级流特征作为状态来捕获机器人的网络行为，产生内容不可知和加密弹性行为特征。这些特征用于训练分类器，以首先检测由机器人产生的流，然后识别它们的机器人家族。我们在来自12个僵尸网络家族的超过700万个恶意流量的数据集上评估了我们的系统，显示了其以99.78%的F-measure检测僵尸网络流量并以99.09%的F-measure将其分类为恶意软件家族的能力。值得注意的是，由于马尔可夫链对一般bot网络行为的建模，BOTection可以检测属于未知bot家族的流量，F-measure为93.03%，使其对恶意软件演变具有鲁棒性。
papers.title_zh: Botection：通过构建Markov链网络行为的Markov链模型来检测机器人检测

papers.title: Cybersecurity Event Detection with New and Re-emerging Words
papers.authors: Hyejin Shin, WooChul Shim, Jiin Moon, Jae Woo Seo, Sol Lee, Yong Ho Hwang
papers.abstract: There is plenty of threat-related information in open data sources. Early identification of emerging security threats from such information is an important part of security for deployed software and systems. While several cybersecurity event detection methods have been proposed to extract security events from unstructured text in open data sources, most of the existing methods focus on detecting events that have a large volume of mentions. On the contrary, to respond faster than attackers, security analysts and IT operators need to be aware of critical security events as early as possible, no matter how many mentions about an event are made. In this paper, we propose a novel event detection system that can quickly identify critical security events, such as new threats and resurgence of an attack or related event, from Twitter regardless of their volume of mentions. Unlike the existing methods, the proposed method triggers events by monitoring new words and re-emerging words, making it possible to narrow down candidate events among several hundreds of events. It then forms events by clustering tweets linked with the trigger words. This approach enables us to detect new and resurgent threats as early as possible. We empirically demonstrate that our system works promisingly over a wide range of threat types.
papers.abstract_zh: 开放数据源中有大量与威胁相关的信息。从这些信息中及早识别新出现的安全威胁是所部署的软件和系统的安全的重要部分。虽然已经提出了几种网络安全事件检测方法来从开放数据源中的非结构化文本中提取安全事件，但是大多数现有方法都专注于检测具有大量提及的事件。相反，为了比攻击者做出更快的响应，安全分析师和IT操作员需要尽可能早地意识到关键的安全事件，无论事件被提及多少次。在本文中，我们提出了一种新的事件检测系统，可以快速识别来自Twitter的关键安全事件，如新的威胁和攻击或相关事件的重现，而不管它们的提及量如何。与现有的方法不同，所提出的方法通过监控新词和重新出现的词来触发事件，使得在数百个事件中缩小候选事件成为可能。然后，它通过聚集与触发词相关联的推文来形成事件。这种方法使我们能够尽早发现新的和重新出现的威胁。我们根据经验证明，我们的系统在各种威胁类型下都能有效工作。
papers.title_zh: 用新的和重新出现的单词检测网络安全事件

papers.title: AMSI-Based Detection of Malicious PowerShell Code Using Contextual Embeddings
papers.authors: Danny Hendler, Shay Kels, Amir Rubin
papers.abstract: PowerShell is a command-line shell, supporting a scripting language. It is widely used in organizations for configuration management and task automation but is also increasingly used for launching cyber attacks against organizations, mainly because it is pre-installed on Windows machines and exposes strong functionality that may be leveraged by attackers. This makes the problem of detecting malicious PowerShell code both urgent and challenging. Microsoft's Antimalware Scan Interface (AMSI), built into Windows 10, allows defending systems to scan all the code passed to scripting engines such as PowerShell prior to its execution. In this work, we conduct the first study of malicious PowerShell code detection using the information made available by AMSI. We present several novel deep-learning based detectors of malicious PowerShell code that employ pretrained contextual embeddings of words from the PowerShell "language". A contextual word embedding is able to project semantically-similar words to proximate vectors in the embedding space. A known problem in the cybersecurity domain is that labeled data is relatively scarce, in comparison with unlabeled data, making it difficult to devise effective supervised detection of malicious activity of many types. This is also the case with PowerShell code. Our work shows that this problem can be mitigated by learning a pretrained contextual embedding based on unlabeled data. We trained and evaluated our models using real-world data, collected using AMSI. The contextual embedding was learnt using a large corpus of unlabeled PowerShell scripts and modules collected from public repositories. Our performance analysis establishes that the use of unlabeled data for the embedding significantly improved the performance of our detectors. Our best-performing model uses an architecture that enables the processing of textual signals from both the character and token levels and obtains a true-positive rate of nearly 90% while maintaining a low false-positive rate of less than 0.1%.
papers.abstract_zh: PowerShell是一个命令行Shell，支持脚本语言。它在组织中广泛用于配置管理和任务自动化，但也越来越多地用于对组织发起网络攻击，这主要是因为它预先安装在Windows计算机上，并暴露了可能被攻击者利用的强大功能。这使得检测恶意PowerShell代码的问题变得既紧迫又具有挑战性。微软的反恶意软件扫描接口(AMSI)内置于Windows 10中，允许防御系统在执行之前扫描所有传递给脚本引擎(如PowerShell)的代码。在这项工作中，我们使用AMSI提供的信息进行了第一次恶意PowerShell代码检测研究。我们提出了几种新颖的基于深度学习的恶意PowerShell代码检测器，这些检测器采用来自PowerShell“语言”的单词的预训练上下文嵌入。上下文单词嵌入能够将语义相似的单词投影到嵌入空间中的邻近向量。网络安全领域中的一个已知问题是，与未标记的数据相比，标记的数据相对稀少，这使得难以设计对多种类型的恶意活动的有效监督检测。PowerShell代码也是如此。我们的工作表明，这个问题可以通过学习基于未标记数据的预训练上下文嵌入来缓解。我们使用AMSI收集的真实世界数据来训练和评估我们的模型。使用从公共存储库中收集的大量未标记的PowerShell脚本和模块来学习上下文嵌入。我们的性能分析表明，使用未标记数据进行嵌入显著提高了我们的检测器的性能。我们性能最好的模型使用了一种架构，能够从字符和标记级别处理文本信号，并获得近90%的真阳性率，同时保持低于0.1%的低假阳性率。
papers.title_zh: 使用上下文嵌入的基于AMSI的恶意Powershell代码检测

papers.title: Hidden in Plain Sight: Obfuscated Strings Threatening Your Privacy
papers.authors: Leonid Glanz, Patrick Müller, Lars Baumgärtner, Michael Reif, Sven Amann, Pauline Anthonysamy, Mira Mezini
papers.abstract: String obfuscation is an established technique used by proprietary, closed-source applications to protect intellectual property. Furthermore, it is also frequently used to hide spyware or malware in applications. In both cases, the techniques range from bit-manipulation over XOR operations to AES encryption. However, string obfuscation techniques/tools suffer from one shared weakness: They generally have to embed the necessary logic to deobfuscate strings into the app code. In this paper, we show that most of the string obfuscation techniques found in malicious and benign applications for Android can easily be broken in an automated fashion. We developed StringHound, an open-source tool that uses novel techniques that identify obfuscated strings and reconstruct the originals using slicing. We evaluated StringHound on both benign and malicious Android apps. In summary, we deobfuscate almost 30 times more obfuscated strings than other string deobfuscation tools. Additionally, we analyzed 100,000 Google Play Store apps and found multiple obfuscated strings that hide vulnerable cryptographic usages, insecure internet accesses, API keys, hard-coded passwords, and exploitation of privileges without the awareness of the developer. Furthermore, our analysis reveals that not only malware uses string obfuscation but also benign apps make extensive use of string obfuscation.
papers.abstract_zh: 字符串混淆是一种成熟的技术，由专有的、封闭源代码的应用程序用来保护知识产权。此外，它还经常用于隐藏应用程序中的间谍软件或恶意软件。在这两种情况下，技术范围从异或运算的位操作到AES加密。然而，字符串模糊技术/工具有一个共同的弱点:它们通常必须在应用程序代码中嵌入必要的逻辑来消除字符串模糊。在本文中，我们展示了在Android的恶意和良性应用程序中发现的大多数字符串混淆技术可以很容易地以自动化的方式被破解。我们开发了StringHound，这是一个开源工具，它使用新颖的技术来识别模糊的字符串，并使用切片来重建原始字符串。我们评估了良性和恶意Android应用程序上的StringHound。总之，我们消除模糊字符串的能力是其他字符串消除工具的30倍。此外，我们分析了100，000个谷歌Play商店应用程序，发现了多个混淆的字符串，这些字符串隐藏了易受攻击的加密用法、不安全的互联网访问、API密钥、硬编码密码以及在开发人员不知情的情况下利用特权。此外，我们的分析显示，不仅恶意软件使用字符串混淆，良性应用程序也大量使用字符串混淆。
papers.title_zh: 隐藏在视线中：混淆的字符串威胁您的隐私

papers.title: Social Botnet Community Detection: A Novel Approach based on Behavioral Similarity in Twitter Network using Deep Learning
papers.authors: Greeshma Lingam, Rashmi Ranjan Rout, Durvasula V. L. N. Somayajulu, Sajal K. Das
papers.abstract: Detecting social bots and identifying social botnet communities are extremely important in online social networks (OSNs). In this paper, we first construct a weighted signed Twitter network graph based on the behavioral similarity and trust values between the participants (i.e., OSN accounts) as weighted edges. The behavioral similarity is analyzed from the viewpoints of tweet-content similarity, shared URL similarity, interest similarity, and social interaction similarity for identifying similar types of behavior (malicious or not) among the participants in the Twitter network; whereas the participant's trust value is determined by a random walk model. Next, we design two algorithms - Social Botnet Community Detection (SBCD) and Deep Autoencoder based SBCD (called DA-SBCD) - where the former detects social botnet communities of social bots with malicious behavioral similarity, while the latter reconstructs and detects social botnet communities more accurately in presence of different types of malicious activities. Finally, we evaluate the performance of proposed algorithms with the help of two Twitter datasets. Experimental results demonstrate the efficacy of our algorithms with better performance than existing schemes in terms of normalized mutual information (NMI), precision, recall and F-measure. More precisely, the DA-SBCD algorithm achieves about 90% precision and exhibits up to 8% improvement on NMI.
papers.abstract_zh: 检测社交僵尸和识别社交僵尸网络社区在在线社交网络中极其重要。在本文中，我们首先基于参与者(即OSN账户)之间的行为相似度和信任值作为加权边，构建一个加权的带符号Twitter网络图。从推特内容相似性、共享URL相似性、兴趣相似性和社交互动相似性的角度分析行为相似性，以识别推特网络中参与者之间的相似类型的行为(恶意或非恶意)；而参与者的信任值由随机行走模型确定。接下来，我们设计了两种算法——社交僵尸网络社区检测(SBCD)和基于深度自动编码器的SBCD(称为DA-SBCD)——其中前者检测具有恶意行为相似性的社交僵尸网络社区，而后者在存在不同类型的恶意活动时更准确地重建和检测社交僵尸网络社区。最后，我们在两个Twitter数据集的帮助下评估了所提算法的性能。实验结果表明，该算法在归一化互信息、查准率、查全率和F-measure方面都优于现有算法。更准确地说，达-SBCD算法实现了约90%的精度，并展示了高达8%的NMI改进。
papers.title_zh: 社交僵尸网络社区检测：一种基于Twitter网络中行为相似性的新方法，使用深度学习

papers.title: LiS: Lightweight Signature Schemes for Continuous Message Authentication in Cyber-Physical Systems
papers.authors: Zheng Yang, Chenglu Jin, Yangguang Tian, Junyu Lai, Jianying Zhou
papers.abstract: Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS) provide the foundation of our critical infrastructures, which form the basis of emerging and future smart services and improve our quality of life in many areas. In such CPS, sensor data is transmitted over the network to the controller, which will make real-time control decisions according to the received sensor data. Due to the existence of spoofing attacks (more specifically to CPS, false data injection attacks), one has to protect the authenticity and integrity of the transmitted data. For example, a digital signature can be used to solve this issue. However, the resource-constrained field devices like sensors cannot afford conventional signature computation. Thus, we have to seek for an efficient signature mechanism that can support the fast and continuous message authentication in CPS, while being easy to compute on the devices. To this end, we introduce two Lightweight Signature schemes (ŁMACH), which are suitable for continuous message authentication commonly seen in cyber-physical systems. In our constructions, we exploit the efficient hash collision generation property of a chameleon hash function to transform a chameleon hash function into signature schemes. In our schemes, the signature of a message m is the randomness r associated with m in a chameleon hash function, such that they can lead to a hash collision with a given message randomness pair $(m', r')$. Thus, the task of a signer is to generate the collision using the private key of the underlying chameleon hash function, and a verifier can verify the signature by checking the hash collision with a known message and randomness pair. We also specifically instantiate the chameleon hash function in such a way that it leads to a fast signing procedure and an optimal storage requirement on the signer side. The optimized signing algorithms are very efficient. Namely, our first scheme requires only three additions and two multiplications, and only one additional hash is needed in the second scheme to resist adaptive chosen message attacks. In addition, the size of the signing key in our schemes is a small constant-sized bit string, which well fits CPS applications.
papers.abstract_zh: 信息物理系统(CPS)为我们的关键基础设施提供了基础，这些基础设施构成了新兴和未来智能服务的基础，并在许多领域提高了我们的生活质量。在这种CPS中，传感器数据通过网络传输到控制器，控制器将根据接收到的传感器数据做出实时控制决策。由于欺骗攻击(更具体地说是CPS，虚假数据注入攻击)的存在，人们必须保护传输数据的真实性和完整性。例如，数字签名可以用来解决这个问题。然而，像传感器这样的资源受限的现场设备不能负担传统的签名计算。因此，我们必须寻求一种有效的签名机制，能够在CPS中支持快速和连续的消息认证，同时易于在设备上计算。为此，我们介绍了两种轻量级签名方案(MACH ),它们适用于信息物理系统中常见的连续消息认证。在我们的构造中，我们利用变色龙哈希函数的高效哈希碰撞生成特性将变色龙哈希函数转化为签名方案。在我们的方案中，消息m的签名是与变色龙散列函数中的m相关联的随机性r，使得它们可以导致与给定的消息随机性对$(m '，r')$的散列冲突。因此，签名者的任务是使用底层变色龙散列函数的私钥生成冲突，验证者可以通过用已知的消息和随机性对检查散列冲突来验证签名。我们还具体实例化了chameleon散列函数，使得它能够在签名者端实现快速签名过程和最佳存储需求。优化后的签名算法非常有效。也就是说，我们的第一个方案只需要三次加法和两次乘法，而第二个方案只需要一个额外的散列来抵抗适应性选择消息攻击。此外，在我们的方案中，签名密钥的大小是一个小的固定大小的比特串，这非常适合CPS应用。
papers.title_zh: LIS：网络物理系统中连续消息身份验证的轻巧签名方案

papers.title: Hunting Sybils in Participatory Mobile Consensus-Based Networks
papers.authors: Nickolai Verchok, Alex Orailoglu
papers.abstract: We focus on detecting adversarial non-existent nodes, Sybils, in anonymized participatory mobile networks where nodes support both a node-to-server and peer-to-peer connection capabilities. As data-driven decisions within such networks typically rely on local consensuses, they are susceptible to adversarial injection attacks which impersonate honest nodes and overpower local data through forgery. First, we propose a scheme wherein nodes validate each other's presence through local peer-to-peer communication. We then observe a fundamental information asymmetry between Sybils and honest nodes, and argue that conventional Sybil detection techniques fail to exploit it. Thereupon, we propose a novel Sybil detection technique tailored to utilizing claimed location data, introduce a probabilistic framework for the problem, and design the statistical approach for finding Sybils. Finally, we compare our detection algorithm with existing methods through complex simulated Sybil scenarios.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们关注于检测匿名参与式移动网络中不存在的敌对节点Sybils，其中节点支持节点到服务器和对等连接能力。由于这种网络中的数据驱动的决策通常依赖于本地共识，因此它们容易受到敌对注入攻击，这些攻击冒充诚实节点并通过伪造压倒本地数据。首先，我们提出一个方案，其中节点通过本地对等通信来验证彼此的存在。然后，我们观察到Sybil和诚实节点之间的基本信息不对称，并认为传统的Sybil检测技术未能利用它。因此，我们提出了一种新的Sybil检测技术，适合于利用声称的位置数据，介绍了问题的概率框架，并设计了发现Sybil的统计方法。最后，我们通过复杂的模拟Sybil场景将我们的检测算法与现有方法进行了比较。
papers.title_zh: 在参与式移动共识网络中狩猎Sybils

papers.title: I came, I saw, I hacked: Automated Generation of Process-independent Attacks for Industrial Control Systems
papers.authors: Esha Sarkar, Hadjer Benkraouda, Michail Maniatakos
papers.abstract: Malicious manipulations on Industrial Control Systems (ICSs) endanger critical infrastructures, causing unprecedented losses. State-of-the-art research in the discovery and exploitation of vulnerability typically assumes full visibility and control of the industrial process, which in real-world scenarios is unrealistic. In this work, we investigate the possibility of an automated end-to-end attack for an unknown control process in the constrained scenario of infecting just one industrial computer. We create databases of human-machine interface images, and Programmable Logic Controller (PLC) binaries using publicly available resources to train machine-learning models for modular and granular fingerprinting of the ICS sectors and the processes, respectively. We then explore control-theoretic attacks on the process leveraging common/ubiquitous control algorithm modules like Proportional Integral Derivative blocks using a PLC binary reverse-engineering tool, causing stable or oscillatory deviations within the operational limits of the plant. We package the automated attack and evaluate it against a benchmark chemical process, demonstrating the feasibility of advanced attacks even in constrained scenarios.
papers.abstract_zh: 对工业控制系统的恶意操作会危及关键基础设施，造成前所未有的损失。在脆弱性的发现和利用方面的最新研究通常假设对工业过程的完全可见性和控制，这在现实世界中是不现实的。在这项工作中，我们研究了在仅感染一台工业计算机的受限场景中，对未知控制过程进行自动端到端攻击的可能性。我们创建人机界面图像数据库和可编程逻辑控制器(PLC)二进制文件，使用公开可用的资源来训练机器学习模型，以分别对ICS部门和流程进行模块化和粒度指纹识别。然后，我们探索了利用公共/无处不在的控制算法模块(如使用PLC二进制逆向工程工具的比例积分微分模块)对过程进行控制理论攻击，从而在工厂的操作限制内造成稳定或振荡偏差。我们将自动攻击打包，并根据基准化学过程对其进行评估，证明了即使在受限场景中高级攻击的可行性。
papers.title_zh: 我看到了，我看到了，我被黑客入侵了：自动生成与工业控制系统的过程无关的攻击

papers.title: Detecting Insecure Code Patterns in Industrial Robot Programs
papers.authors: Marcello Pogliani, Federico Maggi, Marco Balduzzi, Davide Quarta, Stefano Zanero
papers.abstract: Industrial robots are complex and customizable machines that can be programmed with proprietary domain-specific languages. These languages provide not only movement instructions, but also access to low-level system resources such as the network or the file system. Although useful, these features can lead to taint-style vulnerabilities and can be misused to implement malware---on par with general-purpose programming languages. In this paper, we analyze the languages of $8$ leading industrial robot vendors, systematize their technical features, and discuss cases of vulnerable and malicious uses. We then describe a static source-code analyzer that we created to analyze robotic programs and discover insecure or potentially malicious code paths. We focused our proof-of-concept implementation on two popular languages, namely ABB's RAPID and KUKA's KRL. By evaluating our tool on a set of publicly available programs, we show that insecure patterns are found in real-world code; therefore, static source-code analysis is an effective security screening mechanism, for example to prevent commissioning insecure or malicious industrial task programs. Finally, we discuss remediation steps that developers and vendors can adopt to mitigate such issues.
papers.abstract_zh: 工业机器人是复杂和可定制的机器，可以用专有的特定领域语言进行编程。这些语言不仅提供了移动指令，还提供了对底层系统资源(如网络或文件系统)的访问。尽管这些特性很有用，但它们会导致污点式的漏洞，并可能被滥用来实现恶意软件——就像通用编程语言一样。在本文中，我们分析了$8$领先工业机器人供应商的语言，系统化了它们的技术特征，并讨论了易受攻击和恶意使用的案例。然后，我们描述一个静态源代码分析器，我们创建它来分析机器人程序并发现不安全或潜在的恶意代码路径。我们将我们的概念验证实施集中在两种流行语言上，即ABB的RAPID和库卡的KRL。通过在一组公开可用的程序上评估我们的工具，我们表明在现实世界的代码中发现了不安全的模式；因此，静态源代码分析是一种有效的安全筛选机制，例如防止不安全或恶意的工业任务程序的调试。最后，我们讨论了开发人员和供应商可以采取的补救措施，以减轻这些问题。
papers.title_zh: 在工业机器人计划中检测不安全的代码模式

papers.title: EchoLock: Towards Low-effort Mobile User Identification Leveraging Structure-borne Echos
papers.authors: Yilin Yang, Yan Wang, Yingying Chen, Chen Wang
papers.abstract: Many existing identification approaches require active user input, specialized sensing hardware, or personally identifiable information such as fingerprints or face scans. In this paper, we propose EchoLock, a low-effort identification scheme that validates the user by sensing hand geometry via commodity microphones and speakers. EchoLock can serve as a complementary verification method for high-end devices or as a stand-alone user identification scheme for lower-end devices without using privacy-sensitive features. In addition to security applications, our system can also personalize user interactions with smart devices, such as automatically adapting settings or preferences when different people are holding smart remotes. To this end, we study the impact of hands on structure borne sound propagation in mobile devices and develop a user identification scheme that can measure, quantify, and exploit distinct sound reflections in order to differentiate distinct identities. Particularly, we propose a non-intrusive hand sensing technique to derive unique acoustic features in both time and frequency domain, which can effectively capture the physiological and behavioral traits of a user's hand (e.g., hand contours, finger sizes, holding strengths, and holding styles). Furthermore, learning-based algorithms are developed to robustly identify the user under various environments and conditions. We conduct extensive experiments with 20 participants, gathering 80,000 hand geometry samples using different hardware setups across 160 key use case scenarios. Our results show that EchoLock is capable of identifying users with over 94% accuracy, without requiring any active user input.
papers.abstract_zh: 许多现有的识别方法需要主动的用户输入、专门的传感硬件或个人可识别信息，例如指纹或面部扫描。在本文中，我们提出了EchoLock，这是一种通过商品麦克风和扬声器感测手的几何形状来验证用户的低费力识别方案。EchoLock可以作为高端设备的补充验证方法，也可以在不使用隐私敏感功能的情况下，作为低端设备的独立用户识别方案。除了安全应用，我们的系统还可以个性化用户与智能设备的交互，例如当不同的人拿着智能遥控器时，自动调整设置或偏好。为此，我们研究了手对移动设备中结构声传播的影响，并开发了一种用户识别方案，该方案可以测量、量化和利用不同的声音反射，以便区分不同的身份。特别地，我们提出了一种非侵入式手感测技术，以在时域和频域中导出独特的声学特征，其可以有效地捕捉用户的手的生理和行为特征(例如，手轮廓、手指大小、握持力度和握持风格)。此外，基于学习的算法被开发来在各种环境和条件下鲁棒地识别用户。我们对20名参与者进行了广泛的实验，在160个关键用例场景中使用不同的硬件设置收集了80，000个手形样本。我们的结果表明，EchoLock能够以超过94%的准确率识别用户，而不需要任何主动的用户输入。
papers.title_zh: Echolock：迈向低劳动移动用户识别利用结构 - 传播echos

papers.title: Formal Analysis and Implementation of a TPM 2.0-based Direct Anonymous Attestation Scheme
papers.authors: Stephan Wesemeyer, Christopher J. P. Newton, Helen Treharne, Liqun Chen, Ralf Sasse, Jorden Whitefield
papers.abstract: Direct Anonymous Attestation (Daa) is a set of cryptographic schemes used to create anonymous digital signatures. To provide additional assurance, Daa schemes can utilise a Trusted Platform Module (Tpm) that is a tamper-resistant hardware device embedded in a computing platform and which provides cryptographic primitives and secure storage. We extend Chen and Li's Daa scheme to support: 1) signing a message anonymously, 2) self-certifying Tpm keys, and 3) ascertaining a platform's state as recorded by the Tpm's platform configuration registers (PCR) for remote attestation, with explicit reference to Tpm2.0 API calls. We perform a formal analysis of the scheme and are the first symbolic models to explicitly include the low-level Tpm call details. Our analysis reveals that a fix pro-posed by Whitefield et al. to address an authentication attack on an Ecc-Daa scheme is also required by our scheme. Developing a fine-grained, formal model of a Daa scheme contributes to the growing body of work demonstrating the use of formal tools in supporting security analyses of cryptographic protocols. We additionally provide and benchmark an open-source C++implementation of this Daa scheme supporting both a hardware and a software Tpm and measure its performance.
papers.abstract_zh: 直接匿名证明(Daa)是一组用于创建匿名数字签名的加密方案。为了提供额外的保证，Daa方案可以利用可信平台模块(Tpm ),该可信平台模块是嵌入在计算平台中的防篡改硬件设备，并且提供加密原语和安全存储。我们扩展了Chen和Li的Daa方案，以支持:1)匿名签署消息，2)自认证Tpm密钥，以及3)通过明确引用Tpm2.0 API调用，确定由Tpm的平台配置寄存器(PCR)记录的用于远程证明的平台状态。我们对该方案进行了形式分析，并且是第一个明确包含低级Tpm调用细节的符号模型。我们的分析表明，我们的方案也需要Whitefield等人提出的解决对Ecc-Daa方案的认证攻击的补丁。开发一个细粒度的、正式的Daa方案模型有助于证明正式工具在支持加密协议的安全性分析中的使用。此外，我们还提供并测试了该Daa方案的开源c++实现，该实现支持硬件和软件Tpm，并测量了其性能。
papers.title_zh: 基于TPM 2.0的直接匿名认证计划的正式分析和实施

papers.title: DISKSHIELD: A Data Tamper-Resistant Storage for Intel SGX
papers.authors: Jinwoo Ahn, Junghee Lee, Yungwoo Ko, Donghyun Min, Jiyun Park, Sungyong Park, Youngjae Kim
papers.abstract: With the increasing importance of data, the threat of malware which destroys data has been increasing. If malware acquires the highest software privilege, any attempt to detect and remove malware can be disabled. In this paper, we propose DISKSHIELD, a secure storage framework. DISKSHIELD uses Intel SGX to provide Trusted Execution Environment (TEE) to the host, implements the file system into SSD firmware that provides a Trusted Computing Base (TCB), and uses a two-way authentication mechanism to securely transfer data from the host TEE to the SSD TCB against data tampering attacks. This design frees DISKSHIELD from attacks to the kernel. To show the efficacy of DISKSHIELD, we prototyped a DISKSHIELD system by modifying Intel IPFS and developing a device file system on the Jasmine OpenSSD Platform in a Linux environment. Our results show that DISKSHIELD provides strong data tamper resistance the throughput of read and write is on average to 28%, 19% lower than IPFS.
papers.abstract_zh: 随着数据重要性的增加，破坏数据的恶意软件的威胁也在增加。如果恶意软件获得了最高的软件权限，任何检测和删除恶意软件的尝试都会被禁用。在本文中，我们提出了一个安全存储框架DISKSHIELD。DISKSHIELD使用SGX为主机提供可信执行环境(TEE ),将文件系统实施到提供可信计算基础(TCB)的SSD固件中，并使用双向认证机制将数据从主机TEE安全传输到SSD TCB，以防止数据篡改攻击。这种设计使DISKSHIELD免受对内核的攻击。为了展示DISKSHIELD的功效，我们通过修改IPFS并在Linux环境中的Jasmine OpenSSD平台上开发设备文件系统，构建了一个DISKSHIELD系统原型。我们的结果表明，DISKSHIELD提供了强大的数据防篡改能力，读写吞吐量平均为28%，比IPFS低19%。
papers.title_zh: DiskShield：Intel SGX的数据防篡改存储

papers.title: Take A Way: Exploring the Security Implications of AMD's Cache Way Predictors
papers.authors: Moritz Lipp, Vedad Hadzic, Michael Schwarz, Arthur Perais, Clémentine Maurice, Daniel Gruss
papers.abstract: To optimize the energy consumption and performance of their CPUs, AMD introduced a way predictor for the L1-data (L1D) cache to predict in which cache way a certain address is located. Consequently, only this way is accessed, significantly reducing the power consumption of the processor. In this paper, we are the first to exploit the cache way predictor. We reverse-engineered AMD's L1D cache way predictor in microarchitectures from 2011 to 2019, resulting in two new attack techniques. With Collide+Probe, an attacker can monitor a victim?s memory accesses without knowledge of physical addresses or shared memory when time-sharing a logical core. With Load+Reload, we exploit the way predictor to obtain highly-accurate memory-access traces of victims on the same physical core. While Load+Reload relies on shared memory, it does not invalidate the cache line, allowing stealthier attacks that do not induce any last-level-cache evictions. We evaluate our new side channel in different attack scenarios. We demonstrate a covert channel with up to 588.9 kB/s, which we also use in a Spectre attack to exfiltrate secret data from the kernel. Furthermore, we present a key-recovery attack from a vulnerable cryptographic implementation. We also show an entropy-reducing attack on ASLR of the kernel of a fully patched Linux system, the hypervisor, and our own address space from JavaScript. Finally, we propose countermeasures in software and hardware mitigating the presented attacks
papers.abstract_zh: 为了优化CPU的能耗和性能，AMD为L1数据(L1D)缓存引入了路径预测器，以预测特定地址位于哪个缓存路径中。因此，只能访问这一路，从而显著降低了处理器的功耗。在本文中，我们是第一个利用高速缓冲存储器通路预测器的。我们从2011年到2019年在微体系结构中反向工程了AMD的L1D高速缓存路预测器，产生了两种新的攻击技术。利用Collide+Probe，攻击者可以监控受害者？分时访问一个逻辑内核时，不知道物理地址或共享内存。通过Load+Reload，我们利用way predictor来获得相同物理内核上受害者的高精度内存访问跟踪。虽然Load+Reload依赖于共享内存，但它不会使缓存行无效，从而允许不会导致任何末级缓存驱逐的更隐秘的攻击。我们在不同的攻击场景下评估我们的新侧信道。我们演示了一个高达588.9 kB/s的隐蔽通道，我们也在Spectre攻击中使用它来从内核中泄漏秘密数据。此外，我们提出了一个脆弱的加密实现的密钥恢复攻击。我们还展示了对打满补丁的Linux系统内核、系统管理程序和我们自己的JavaScript地址空间的ASLR的熵减少攻击。最后，我们从软件和硬件两个方面提出了缓解这些攻击的对策
papers.title_zh: 采取方法：探索AMD的缓存方式预测变量的安全含义

papers.title: Uranus: Simple, Efficient SGX Programming and its Applications
papers.authors: Jianyu Jiang, Xusheng Chen, Tsz On Li, Cheng Wang, Tianxiang Shen, Shixiong Zhao, Heming Cui, Cho-Li Wang, Fengwei Zhang
papers.abstract: Applications written in Java have strengths to tackle diverse threats in public clouds, but these applications are still prone to privileged attacks when processing plaintext data. Intel SGX is powerful to tackle these attacks, and traditional SGX systems rewrite a Java application's sensitive functions, which process plaintext data, using C/C++ SGX API. Although this code-rewrite approach achieves good efficiency and a small TCB, it requires SGX expert knowledge and can be tedious and error-prone. To tackle the limitations of rewriting Java to C/C++, recent SGX systems propose a code-reuse approach, which runs a default JVM in an SGX enclave to execute the sensitive Java functions. However, both recent study and this paper find that running a default JVM in enclaves incurs two major vulnerabilities, Iago attacks, and control flow leakage of sensitive functions, due to the usage of OS features in JVM. In this paper, Uranus creates easy-to-use Java programming abstractions for application developers to annotate sensitive functions, and Uranus automatically runs these functions in SGX at runtime. Uranus effectively tackles the two major vulnerabilities in the code-reuse approach by presenting two new protocols: 1) a Java bytecode attestation protocol for dynamically loaded functions; and 2) an OS-decoupled, efficient GC protocol optimized for data-handling applications running in enclaves. We implemented Uranus in Linux and applied it to two diverse data-handling applications: Spark and ZooKeeper. Evaluation shows that: 1) Uranus achieves the same security guarantees as two relevant SGX systems for these two applications with only a few annotations; 2) Uranus has reasonable performance overhead compared to the native, insecure applications; and 3) Uranus defends against privileged attacks. Uranus source code and evaluation results are released on https://github.com/hku-systems/uranus.
papers.abstract_zh: 用Java编写的应用程序有能力应对公共云中的各种威胁，但是这些应用程序在处理明文数据时仍然容易受到特权攻击。英特尔SGX在应对这些攻击方面非常强大，传统的SGX系统使用C/C++ SGX API重写了处理明文数据的Java应用的敏感函数。尽管这种代码重写方法实现了良好的效率和较小的TCB，但它需要SGX专家的知识，并且可能很繁琐且容易出错。为了解决将Java重写为C/C++的局限性，最近的SGX系统提出了一种代码重用方法，它在SGX的飞地中运行一个默认的JVM来执行敏感的Java函数。然而，最近的研究和本文都发现，由于在JVM中使用了操作系统特性，在enclaves中运行默认JVM会导致两个主要的漏洞，Iago攻击和敏感函数的控制流泄漏。在这篇论文中，Uranus为应用程序开发人员创建了易于使用的Java编程抽象来注释敏感函数，并且Uranus在运行时自动在SGX中运行这些函数。Uranus通过提出两个新协议有效地解决了代码重用方法中的两个主要漏洞:1)用于动态加载函数的Java字节码证明协议；2)一个与操作系统分离的高效GC协议，针对在飞地中运行的数据处理应用进行了优化。我们在Linux中实现了Uranus，并将其应用于两个不同的数据处理应用程序:Spark和ZooKeeper。评估表明:1)对于这两个应用程序，天王星仅用很少的注释就实现了与两个相关SGX系统相同的安全保证；2)与本地的、不安全的应用程序相比，天王星具有合理的性能开销；以及3)天王星防御特权攻击。天王星源代码和评估结果在https://github.com/hku-systems/uranus.上发布
papers.title_zh: 天王星：简单，高效的SGX编程及其应用程序

papers.title: Post-Quantum TLS on Embedded Systems: Integrating and Evaluating Kyber and SPHINCS+ with mbed TLS
papers.authors: Kevin Bürstinghaus-Steinbach, Christoph Krauß, Ruben Niederhagen, Michael Schneider
papers.abstract: We present our integration of post-quantum cryptography (PQC), more specifically of the post-quantum KEM scheme Kyber for key establishment and the post-quantum signature scheme SPHINCS+, into the embedded TLS library mbed TLS. We measure the performance of these post-quantum primitives on four different embedded platforms with three different ARM processors and an Xtensa LX6 processor. Furthermore, we compare the performance of our experimental PQC cipher suite to a classical TLS variant using elliptic curve cryptography (ECC). Post-quantum key establishment and signature schemes have been either integrated into TLS or ported to embedded devices before. However, to the best of our knowledge, we are the first to combine TLS, post-quantum schemes, and embedded systems and to measure and evaluate the performance of post-quantum TLS on embedded platforms. Our results show that post-quantum key establishment with Kyber performs well in TLS on embedded devices compared to ECC variants. The use of SPHINCS+ signatures comes with certain challenges in terms of signature size and signing time, which mainly affects the use of embedded systems as PQC-TLS server but does not necessarily prevent embedded systems to act as PQC-TLS clients.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们将后量子密码术(PQC)，更具体地说是用于密钥建立的后量子KEM方案Kyber和后量子签名方案SPHINCS+集成到嵌入式TLS库mbed TLS中。我们使用三个不同的ARM处理器和一个Xtensa LX6处理器在四个不同的嵌入式平台上测量了这些后量子原语的性能。此外，我们将实验PQC密码套件的性能与使用椭圆曲线密码(ECC)的经典TLS变体进行了比较。后量子密钥建立和签名方案以前要么被集成到TLS中，要么被移植到嵌入式设备。然而，据我们所知，我们是第一个将TLS、后量子方案和嵌入式系统结合起来，并在嵌入式平台上测量和评估后量子TLS性能的人。我们的结果表明，与ECC变体相比，使用Kyber的后量子密钥建立在嵌入式设备上的TLS中表现良好。SPHINCS+签名的使用在签名大小和签名时间方面带来了一定的挑战，这主要影响嵌入式系统作为PQC-TLS服务器的使用，但不一定阻止嵌入式系统作为PQC-TLS客户端。
papers.title_zh: 嵌入式系统上的量子后TL：与MBED TLS集成和评估kyber和phincs+

papers.title: ModFalcon: Compact Signatures Based On Module-NTRU Lattices
papers.authors: Chitchanok Chuengsatiansup, Thomas Prest, Damien Stehlé, Alexandre Wallet, Keita Xagawa
papers.abstract: Lattices lead to promising practical post-quantum digital signatures, combining asymptotic efficiency with strong theoretical security guarantees. However, tuning their parameters into practical instantiations is a delicate task. On the one hand, NIST round~2 candidates based on Lyubashevsky's design (such as dilithium and qtesla) allow several tradeoffs between security and efficiency, but at the expense of a large bandwidth consumption. On the other hand, the hash-and-sign falcon signature is much more compact and is still very efficient, but it allows only two security levels, with large compactness and security gaps between them. We introduce a new family of signature schemes based on the falcon design, which relies on module lattices. Our concrete instantiation enjoys the compactness and efficiency of falcon, and allows an intermediate security level. It leads to the most compact lattice-based signature achieving a quantum security above 128 bits.
papers.abstract_zh: 格导致有希望的实用后量子数字签名，结合渐近效率与强大的理论安全保证。然而，将它们的参数调整成实际的实例化是一项微妙的任务。一方面，基于Lyubashevsky设计的NIST round~2候选(如dilithium和qtesla)允许在安全性和效率之间进行一些权衡，但代价是消耗大量带宽。另一方面，hash-and-sign falcon签名要紧凑得多，并且仍然非常高效，但是它只允许两个安全级别，紧凑性很大，并且它们之间存在安全差距。我们引入了一个新的基于falcon设计的签名方案，它依赖于模格。我们的具体实例化享有falcon的紧凑性和高效性，并允许中间安全级别。它导致最紧凑的基于格的签名实现了128比特以上的量子安全性。
papers.title_zh: Modfalcon：基于模块ntru lattices的紧凑型签名

papers.title: Lattice Klepto Revisited
papers.authors: Zhaomin Yang, Tianyuan Xie, Yanbin Pan
papers.abstract: Kleptography introduced by Young and Yung is about using an embedded backdoor to perform attacks on a cryptosystems. At SAC'17, Kwantet al. proposed a kleptographic backdoor on NTRU encryption scheme and thought that the backdoor can not be detected. However, in this paper we show that the user can detect the backdoor very efficiently and hence the problem of constructing a kleptographic backdoor on NTRU stays open. Moreover, we also design a universal method to embed a kleptographic backdoor for RLWE-based scheme, such as NewHope. Our construction is shown to be strongly undetectable, which reveals the threats of the kleptographic attacks on lattice-based schemes.
papers.abstract_zh: 由Young和Yung提出的盗图术是关于使用嵌入的后门对密码系统进行攻击。在SAC’17上，Kwantet等人提出了一个窃取NTRU加密方案的后门，并认为该后门是不可检测的。然而，在本文中，我们表明，用户可以非常有效地检测到后门，因此，在NTRU上构建盗窃后门的问题仍然存在。此外，我们还设计了一个通用的方法来为基于RLWE的方案，如NewHope，嵌入一个盗窃后门。我们的构造被证明是强不可检测的，这揭示了盗窃攻击对基于格的方案的威胁。
papers.title_zh: lattice klepto重新审视

papers.title: It all Started with Compression: Another Look at Reconciliation Mechanism
papers.authors: Tianyuan Xie, Yanbin Pan
papers.abstract: In a (Ring-)LWE-based key exchange scheme, the error reconciliation technique is usually employed to help the two parties establish the exactly same shared key. In an error reconciliation mechanism, a hint should be produced and sent by one party, which makes the key exchange scheme sequential and the two parties asymmetrical. There is an alternative approach to realize key exchange, the encryption-based key encapsulation mechanism (KEM), where a message is encrypted by one party and the other party decrypts the corresponding ciphertext to derive the shared key from the recovered message. In this paper, we try to unify the two approaches and show that the two mainstream reconciliation instantiations, Ding et. al's branch and Peikert's branch, can both be derived by just choosing a certain message in some encryption-based KEMs we constructed, in which the compressed ciphertext is just the hint and the certain message is exactly the reconciled value. This explains why reconciliation-based key exchange scheme must be sequential and have two asymmetrical parties and will bring more generalization for reconciliation mechanism. As a byproduct, a new (Ring-)LWE-based encryption structure is proposed.
papers.abstract_zh: 在基于(环)LWE的密钥交换方案中，通常采用错误协调技术来帮助双方建立完全相同的共享密钥。在错误协调机制中，提示应该由一方产生和发送，这使得密钥交换方案是顺序的，并且双方是非对称的。还有一种实现密钥交换的替代方法，即基于加密的密钥封装机制(KEM)，其中一方对消息进行加密，另一方对相应的密文进行解密，从恢复的消息中导出共享密钥。在本文中，我们试图统一这两种方法，并表明两个主流的和解实例，丁等人。al的分支和Peikert的分支都可以通过在我们构造的一些基于加密的KEMs中选择某个消息来导出，其中压缩密文就是提示，而该消息就是调和值。这解释了为什么基于调和的密钥交换方案必须是顺序的，并且有两个非对称的参与方，这将为调和机制带来更大的通用性。作为副产品，提出了一种新的基于(环)LWE的加密结构。
papers.title_zh: 一切始于压缩：另一个查看和解机制

papers.title: POSTER: How Do Suspicious Accounts Participate in Online Political Discussions? A Preliminary Study in Taiwan
papers.authors: Ming-Hung Wang, Yu-Chen Dai
papers.abstract: Social network platforms have become popular channels for election campaigns and political propaganda in recent years. However, some entities may employ a group of accounts to generate and shape public opinions. This study investigated the publication and commenting activities by collecting a 6-month-long user behavior data on the most extensively used online forum in Taiwan during a local election in 2018. A series of comparative studies between normal and verified malicious accounts are conducted. From the results, we find malicious authors published articles with more comments and received polarized ratings from online users.
papers.abstract_zh: 近年来，社交网络平台已经成为竞选和政治宣传的流行渠道。然而，一些实体可以利用一组账户来产生和影响公众意见。本研究通过收集2018年地方选举期间台湾使用最广泛的在线论坛上长达6个月的用户行为数据，调查了发布和评论活动。一系列的比较研究之间的正常和验证的恶意帐户进行。从结果中，我们发现恶意作者发表了更多评论的文章，并从在线用户那里获得了两极分化的评级。
papers.title_zh: 海报：可疑帐户如何参与在线政治讨论？ 台湾的初步研究

papers.title: POSTER: Towards Automating Detection of Anomalous HTTP Requests with Joint Probability Estimation of Characters
papers.authors: Pratibha Khandait, Neminath Hubballi, Katrin Franke
papers.abstract: Web applications are often exploited using different techniques like injection, buffer overflow, etc. An HTTP request carrying such malicious content will be different from a normal request. In this paper we propose to detect such anomalous HTTP requests using regular expression based signatures. These signatures are generated using character combinations specifically identified from known malicious requests. We identify certain characters which are useful for differentiating normal and anomalous requests using their frequency value comparison and subsequently select those combinations which have high chances of appearing together by estimating their joint probability values. We experiment with few sample attack types and show that proposed method can identify anomalous HTTP requests.
papers.abstract_zh: Web应用程序经常被利用不同的技术，如注入、缓冲区溢出等。携带此类恶意内容的HTTP请求将不同于正常请求。在本文中，我们建议使用基于正则表达式的签名来检测这种异常的HTTP请求。这些签名是使用从已知恶意请求中专门识别的字符组合生成的。我们使用它们的频率值比较来识别对区分正常和异常请求有用的某些特征，并且随后通过估计它们的联合概率值来选择那些有高机会一起出现的组合。我们用几个样本攻击类型进行了实验，结果表明提出的方法能够识别异常的HTTP请求。
papers.title_zh: 海报：旨在自动检测异常HTTP请求，并与字符的联合概率估算

papers.title: POSTER: Dynamic Software Vulnerabilities Threat Prediction through Social Media Contextual Analysis
papers.authors: Shin-Ying Huang, Yiju Wu
papers.abstract: Publicly available software vulnerabilities and exploit codes are often utilized by malicious actors to launch cyberattack to vulnerable targets. Therefore, organizations not only need to update their software to the latest version, they need to do effective patch management and also prioritize the patching schedule. In order to prevent future cyber threat based on publicly available resources on the Internet, this study propose a dynamic vulnerability threat assessment model to predict the exploited tendency for each vulnerability (i.e., CVE). The model considers many aspects of vulnerability which are gathered from multiple sources. Features range from profile information to contextual information of Twitter discussion about these vulnerabilities. When applied to predict the vulnerabilities exploitation in real world data, it showed better prediction accuracy using our approach and has been deployed into our threat intelligence platform as one of the analytic functions.
papers.abstract_zh: 公开可用的软件漏洞和利用代码经常被恶意行为者用来对易受攻击的目标发起网络攻击。因此，组织不仅需要将其软件更新到最新版本，还需要进行有效的补丁管理，并确定补丁安装计划的优先级。为了基于互联网上公开可用的资源来预防未来的网络威胁，本研究提出了一个动态漏洞威胁评估模型来预测每个漏洞(即CVE)被利用的趋势。该模型考虑了从多个来源收集的脆弱性的许多方面。特征范围从个人资料信息到关于这些漏洞的Twitter讨论的上下文信息。当应用于预测真实世界数据中的漏洞利用时，使用我们的方法显示了更好的预测准确性，并且已经作为分析功能之一部署到我们的威胁情报平台中。
papers.title_zh: 海报：动态软件漏洞通过社交媒体上下文分析威胁预测

papers.title: POSTER: Oblivious Access System on Decentralized Database over Parallel Smart Contract Model
papers.authors: Zhong-Yi Guo, Yu-Chi Chen, Hsiu-Ping Lin
papers.abstract: Data stored on centralized cloud servers may have some risks. Moreover, it may leak the data access pattern when accessing data on cloud servers. Oblivious RAM (ORAM) is a candidate solution to hide the data access pattern, but it inherently induces some overheads of accessing data. In this paper, we address the issues above, and propose the oblivious access system on decentralized database over parallel smart contract model. The proposed system can slightly reduce the overhead of ORAM and overcome the problem from centralized servers. The main techniques are to use parallel smart contract model to improve the performance of smart contract execution and garbled circuit to reduce the cost of communication.
papers.abstract_zh: 存储在集中式云服务器上的数据可能存在一些风险。此外，当访问云服务器上的数据时，它可能会泄漏数据访问模式。不经意内存(ORAM)是隐藏数据访问模式的一种候选解决方案，但它本身会导致一些数据访问开销。本文针对上述问题，提出了基于并行智能契约模型的分布式数据库不经意访问系统。所提出的系统可以略微减少ORAM的开销，并克服集中式服务器带来的问题。主要技术是使用并行智能契约模型来提高智能契约执行的性能，使用乱码电路来降低通信成本。
papers.title_zh: 海报：通过平行智能合约模型在分散数据库上忽略的访问系统

papers.title: POSTER: Data Leakage Detection for Health Information System based on Memory Introspection
papers.authors: Sanoop Mallissery, Min-Chieh Wu, Chun-An Bau, Guan-Zhang Huang, Chen-Yu Yang, Wei-Chun Lin, Yu-Sung Wu
papers.abstract: The abundance of highly sensitive personal information in the Health Information System (HIS) has made it a prime target of data breach attacks. However, securing the system with existing Data Leakage Prevention (DLP) solutions is difficult due to a lack of security perimeter and diverse composition of software components. We propose the use of hypervisor-based memory introspection for implementing data leakage detection in such an environment. The approach looks for the presence of sensitive raw data in the memory of both the client machines and the server machines, transcending the dependence of pre-existing security perimeters. It is inherently compatible with different types of application software and robust against transport or at-rest data encryption. A prototype has been built on the Bareflank hypervisor and the OpenEMR platform. The evaluation results confirmed the effectiveness of the approach.
papers.abstract_zh: 医疗信息系统(HIS)中的大量高度敏感的个人信息使其成为数据泄露攻击的主要目标。然而，由于缺乏安全边界和软件组件的多样化构成，使用现有的数据泄漏防护(DLP)解决方案来保护系统是困难的。我们建议在这样的环境中使用基于管理程序的内存自检来实现数据泄漏检测。该方法寻找客户端机器和服务器机器的存储器中敏感原始数据的存在，超越了对预先存在的安全边界的依赖。它本质上与不同类型的应用程序软件兼容，并且能够抵御传输或静态数据加密。在Bareflank虚拟机管理程序和OpenEMR平台上构建了一个原型。评价结果证实了该方法的有效性。
papers.title_zh: 海报：基于记忆内置的健康信息系统的数据泄漏检测

papers.title: POSTER: Attacks to Federated Learning: Responsive Web User Interface to Recover Training Data from User Gradients
papers.authors: Hans Albert Lianto, Yang Zhao, Jun Zhao
papers.abstract: Local differential privacy (LDP) is an emerging privacy standard to protect individual user data. One scenario where LDP can be applied is federated learning, where each user sends in his/her user gradients to an aggregator who uses these gradients to perform stochastic gradient descent. In a case where the aggregator is untrusted and LDP is not applied to each user gradient, the aggregator can recover sensitive user data from these gradients. In this paper, we present a new interactive web demo showcasing the power of local differential privacy by visualizing federated learning with local differential privacy. Moreover, the live demo shows how LDP can prevent untrusted aggregators from recovering sensitive training data. A measure called the exp-hamming recovery is also created to show the extent of how much data the aggregator can recover.
papers.abstract_zh: 本地差分隐私(LDP)是保护个人用户数据的新兴隐私标准。可以应用LDP的一个场景是联合学习，其中每个用户将他/她的用户梯度发送到聚合器，聚合器使用这些梯度来执行随机梯度下降。在聚集器不受信任并且LDP没有应用于每个用户梯度的情况下，聚集器可以从这些梯度中恢复敏感的用户数据。在本文中，我们提出了一个新的交互式web演示，通过可视化具有局部差分隐私的联合学习来展示局部差分隐私的强大功能。此外，现场演示展示了LDP如何防止不受信任的聚合器恢复敏感的训练数据。还创建了一种称为exp-hamming recovery的方法来显示聚合器可以恢复多少数据。
papers.title_zh: 海报：对联邦学习的攻击：响应式Web用户界面以从用户渐变中恢复培训数据

papers.title: POSTER: SecretSVM - Secret Sharing-Based SVM for Preventing Collusion in IoT Data Analysis
papers.authors: Song-Yi Hsu, Xin Xie, Yu-Chi Chen
papers.abstract: Support vector machine (SVM) is widely used because of its efficiency in data processing. Single source data may not train a nice SVM, since a single entity isn't having enough data with adequate attributes. Thus, multiple source data need to share data to combine a dataset with different attributes, and then jointly train a classifier. However, outsourcing data to a cloud for training induces two security concerns, data privacy and collusion with the cloud and providers. In this paper, we consider a distributed scenario without any centralized party in which IoT data providers will jointly serve as the leader to obtain some parameters. We propose a privacy-preserving and collusion-free SVM (so-called SecretSVM)built from secret sharing and distributed consensus. Participants train intermediate values to provide the necessary interaction andprevent against collusion attacks.
papers.abstract_zh: 支持向量机(SVM)因其在数据处理方面的高效性而被广泛应用。单一源数据可能无法训练出一个好的SVM，因为单个实体没有足够的数据和足够的属性。因此，多个源数据需要共享数据来组合不同属性的数据集，然后联合训练一个分类器。然而，将数据外包给云进行培训会引发两个安全问题，数据隐私和与云和提供商的勾结。在本文中，我们考虑了一个没有任何集中方的分布式场景，其中物联网数据提供商将共同作为领导者来获取一些参数。我们提出了一个基于秘密共享和分布式共识的保护隐私和无共谋的SVM(所谓的SecretSVM)。参与者训练中间值以提供必要的交互并防止共谋攻击。
papers.title_zh: 海报：SecretSVM-基于秘密共享的SVM，用于防止IoT数据分析中的勾结

papers.title: POSTER: Content-Agnostic Identification of Cryptojacking in Network Traffic
papers.authors: Yebo Feng, Devkishen Sisodia, Jun Li
papers.abstract: In this paper, we propose a method that detects cryptojacking activities by analyzing content-agnostic network traffic flows. Our method first distinguishes crypto-mining activities by profiling the traffic with fast Fourier transform at each time window. It then generates the variation vectors between adjacent time windows and leverages a recurrent neural network to identify the cryptojacking patterns. Compared with the existing approaches, this method is privacy-preserving and can identify both browser-based and malware-based cryptojacking activities. Additionally, this method is easy to deploy. It can monitor all the devices within a network by accessing packet headers from the gateway router.
papers.abstract_zh: 在本文中，我们提出了一种通过分析内容不可知的网络流量来检测密码劫持行为的方法。我们的方法首先通过在每个时间窗口用快速傅立叶变换分析流量来区分密码挖掘活动。然后，它生成相邻时间窗口之间的变化向量，并利用递归神经网络来识别密码劫持模式。与现有方法相比，该方法具有隐私保护性，能够识别基于浏览器和基于恶意软件的密码劫持行为。此外，这种方法易于部署。它可以通过从网关路由器访问数据包报头来监控网络中的所有设备。
papers.title_zh: 海报：网络流量中加密夹的内容 - 不合时宜的识别

papers.title: POSTER: Data Collection via Local Differential Privacy with Secret Parameters
papers.authors: Shun Takagi, Yang Cao, Masatoshi Yoshikawa
papers.abstract: Local Differential Privacy (LDP) is attracting industries and researchers as a way of collecting data from individuals while preserving their privacy. LDP provides a strong privacy guarantee; however, it causes a decrease of utility so that we can only apply LDP to simple tasks such as heavy hitter estimation. In this paper, to solve the issue, we explore the amplification of the privacy of LDP with a small loss of utility. In LDP, a privacy parameter which decides the level of privacy protection is treated as the public information or common parameter in a data collection protocol. However, LDP requires that data providers perturb their data on their device, so naturally, data providers can choose and keep their preferred privacy parameter secret. In this paper, we study how the privacy level and utility change in a new privacy model, Parameter Blending Privacy, that the data providers keep their privacy parameter secret. The result concludes that this manipulation amplifies the privacy level with a small loss of utility, so it improves utility-privacy trade-off.
papers.abstract_zh: 本地差分隐私(LDP)作为一种在保护个人隐私的同时收集个人数据的方式，正在吸引着行业和研究人员。LDP提供了强大的隐私保证；然而，这导致了效用的降低，以至于我们只能将LDP应用于简单的任务，例如重打估计。在本文中，为了解决这个问题，我们探索了在较小的效用损失下LDP的保密性的放大。在LDP中，决定隐私保护级别的隐私参数被视为数据收集协议中的公共信息或公共参数。然而，LDP要求数据提供者在他们的设备上干扰他们的数据，因此自然地，数据提供者可以选择并保持他们偏好的隐私参数秘密。在本文中，我们研究了一种新的隐私模型，参数混合隐私，数据提供者对其隐私参数保密时，隐私级别和效用的变化。结果表明，这种操作以较小的效用损失放大了隐私级别，因此它改善了效用-隐私权衡。
papers.title_zh: 海报：通过秘密参数通过当地差异隐私收集数据

papers.title: POSTER: Protecting Location Privacy on Road Networks
papers.authors: Shun Takagi, Yang Cao, Yasuhito Asano, Masatoshi Yoshikawa
papers.abstract: Our recent proposed notion Geo-Graph-Indistinguishability (GeoGI) is a theoretically rigorous location privacy notion which extends differential privacy to the setting of location privacy on a road network modeled by a graph. GeoGI is practically more useful for protecting location privacy in location-based services (LBSs) such as UBER than a previously proposed Geo-Indistinguishability (Geo-I), which is a popular notion of location privacy defined on the Euclidean plane. We also proposed a Graph-Exponential Mechanism (GEM) based on GeoGI. In this paper, we analyze the utility and privacy of GEM. This analysis makes following two contributions to build a user-friendly location perturbation system. First, our proposed system makes a privacy parameter easy to interpret. The privacy parameter of GEM is not interpretable for ordinary people. By converting to the interpretable value, a user can choose his/her preferred privacy level and utility. Second, we formalize an optimization problem to find the optimal range of GEM according to an arbitrary LBS w.r.t the utility-privacy trade-off for a certain user. Experimental results with real-world data show that our optimization improves the utility-privacy trade-off.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们最近提出的地理图不可区分性(GeoGI)概念是一个理论上严格的位置隐私概念，它将差分隐私扩展到由图建模的道路网络上的位置隐私设置。与之前提出的地理不可区分性(Geo-I)相比，GeoGI在保护基于位置的服务(LBSs)如UBER中的位置隐私方面实际上更有用，Geo-I是在欧几里德平面上定义的位置隐私的流行概念。我们还提出了一种基于GeoGI的图指数机制。本文分析了GEM的效用性和私密性。该分析对建立用户友好的位置扰动系统做出了以下两个贡献。首先，我们提出的系统使得隐私参数易于解释。GEM的隐私参数不是普通人能解读的。通过转换成可解释的值，用户可以选择他/她偏好的隐私级别和效用。其次，我们形式化了一个优化问题，根据任意的LBS w.r .对某个用户的效用-隐私折衷来寻找最优的GEM范围。真实世界数据的实验结果表明，我们的优化改进了效用-隐私折衷。
papers.title_zh: 海报：保护路线网络上的位置隐私

papers.title: POSTER: Distributed SSH Bruteforce Attack Detection with Flow Content Similarity and Login Failure Reputation
papers.authors: Neminath Hubballi, Namrata Tiwari, Pratibha Khandait
papers.abstract: In this paper we propose a method to detect distributed bruteforcing by modeling failed login attempts as a Poisson probability distribution. We use content similarity between known SSH connection and flow characteristics of failed login attempts to attribute a flow to SSH application and subsequently either as failure or success. Using the failed login count in a window time, we label window as either normal or containing bruteforce attempts.
papers.abstract_zh: 在本文中，我们提出了一种通过将失败的登录尝试建模为泊松概率分布来检测分布式暴力的方法。我们使用已知SSH连接和失败登录尝试的流特征之间的内容相似性来将流归因于SSH应用程序，并随后作为失败或成功。使用窗口时间内的失败登录计数，我们将窗口标记为正常或包含暴力尝试。
papers.title_zh: 海报：分布式SSH Bruteforce攻击检测具有流量内容相似性和登录失败声誉

papers.title: POSTER: Mitigating Memory Sharing-based Side-channel Attack by Embedding Random Values in Binary for Cloud Environment
papers.authors: Taehun Kim, Youngjoo Shin
papers.abstract: Memory deduplication is a technique that eliminates duplicate physical pages among virtual machines (VMs). Despite the advantage of efficient memory utilization in cloud computing, it leads to memory sharing-based side-channel attacks. Accordingly, most cloud service providers nowadays disable the memory deduplication on their servers to mitigate threats of the attacks, which comes at the cost of the efficiency loss. In this paper, we propose a novel mitigation technique for cloud computing environments against memory sharing-based side-channel attacks. Our technique converts vulnerable applications to secure ones that resist against the attacks. In particular, we utilize binary instrumentation to embed a secret random value inside an executable binary of the application. The random value will prevent memory sharing of security-sensitive applications with other from different security domains. On the other hand, the application-specific approach allows the systemwide memory deduplication, which preserves the efficient memory usage. We present the design and implementation of proposed mitigation as well as its evaluation results.
papers.abstract_zh: 内存重复数据删除是一种消除虚拟机(VM)中重复物理页面的技术。尽管云计算具有高效利用内存的优势，但这导致了基于内存共享的旁路攻击。因此，目前大多数云服务提供商禁用其服务器上的内存重复数据删除以减轻攻击威胁，这是以效率损失为代价的。在本文中，我们提出了一种新的针对云计算环境下基于内存共享的旁路攻击的缓解技术。我们的技术将易受攻击的应用程序转换成抵御攻击的安全应用程序。特别是，我们利用二进制工具在应用程序的可执行二进制文件中嵌入一个秘密的随机值。随机值将防止安全敏感应用与来自不同安全域的其他应用共享存储器。另一方面，特定于应用程序的方法允许系统范围的内存重复数据删除，从而保持高效的内存使用。我们介绍了建议的缓解措施的设计和实施及其评估结果。
papers.title_zh: 海报：通过将随机值嵌入二进制中的云环境中的随机值来减轻内存共享的侧通道攻击

papers.title: POSTER: Detecting Suspicious Processes from Log-Data via a Bayesian Block Model
papers.authors: Daniel Andrade, Yusuke Takahashi, Daichi Hasumi
papers.abstract: Analyzing the behavior of an attacker is critical for determining the scope of damage of a cyber attack, recovering, and fixing system vulnerabilities. However, finding all attacker's traces from log data is a laborsome task, where the performance of existing machine learning methods is still insufficient. In this work, we focus on the task of detecting all processes that were executed by the attacker. For this task, standard anomaly detection methods like Isolation Forest, perform poorly, due to many processes that are used by both the attacker and the client user. Therefore, we propose to incorporate prior knowledge about the temporal concentration of the attacker's activity. In general, we expect that an attacker is active only during a relatively small time window (block assumption), rather than being active at completely random time points. We propose a generative model that allows us to incorporate such prior knowledge effectively. Experiments on intrusion log data, shows that the proposed method achieves considerably better detection performance than a strong baseline method which also incorporates the block assumption.
papers.abstract_zh: 分析攻击者的行为对于确定网络攻击的破坏范围、恢复和修复系统漏洞至关重要。然而，从日志数据中发现所有攻击者的踪迹是一项费力的任务，现有的机器学习方法的性能仍然不足。在这项工作中，我们的重点是检测攻击者执行的所有进程。对于这项任务，标准的异常检测方法(如隔离林)表现不佳，因为攻击者和客户端用户都使用许多进程。因此，我们建议将攻击者活动的时间集中的先验知识结合起来。一般来说，我们预计攻击者只在相对较小的时间窗口内活动(block假设)，而不是在完全随机的时间点活动。我们提出了一个生成模型，允许我们有效地整合这些先验知识。在入侵日志数据上的实验表明，所提出的方法比采用块假设的强基线方法具有更好的检测性能。
papers.title_zh: 海报：通过贝叶斯块模型从log-data中检测可疑过程

papers.title: POSTER: Blockchain-Based Differential Privacy Cost Management System
papers.authors: Leong Mei Han, Yang Zhao, Jun Zhao
papers.abstract: Privacy preservation is a big concern for various sectors. To protect individual user data, one emerging technology is differential privacy. However, it still has limitations for datasets with frequent queries, such as the fast accumulation of privacy cost. To tackle this limitation, this paper explores the integration of a secured decentralised ledger, blockchain. Blockchain will be able to keep track of all noisy responses generated with differential privacy algorithm and allow for certain queries to reuse old responses. In this paper, a demo of a proposed blockchain-based privacy management system is designed as an interactive decentralised web application (DApp). The demo created illustrates that leveraging on blockchain will allow the total privacy cost accumulated to decrease significantly.
papers.abstract_zh: 隐私保护是各行各业都非常关心的问题。为了保护个人用户数据，一种新兴技术是差分隐私。然而，对于频繁查询的数据集，它仍然存在局限性，如隐私代价的快速累积。为了解决这一限制，本文探讨了一个安全的分散分类帐，区块链集成。区块链将能够跟踪差分隐私算法生成的所有嘈杂响应，并允许某些查询重复使用旧响应。在这篇论文中，一个基于区块链的隐私管理系统的演示被设计为一个交互式的分散式网络应用程序(DApp)。创建的演示说明，利用区块链将允许累计的总隐私成本显著降低。
papers.title_zh: 海报：基于区块链的差异隐私成本管理系统

papers.title: POSTER: Expanding a Programmable CPS Testbed for Network Attack Analysis
papers.authors: Seungoh Choi, Jeong-Han Yun, Byung-Gil Min, HyoungChun Kim
papers.abstract: In CPS security research, a test environment and datasets that reflect the real world are crucial. We have constructed the HAI testbed, which provides a function to automatically control all sensors and actuators. Moreover, we have published a control system dataset named HAI dataset, obtained from the testbed according to a premeditated physical attack scenario. Although the HAI dataset sufficiently simulates the behavior of the field devices, the dataset does not contain the phase of cyberattack propagation through the network. In this study, we expanded the HAI testbed to reproduce and analyze network attacks and verified an expanded HAI testbed.
papers.abstract_zh: 在CPS安全研究中，反映真实世界的测试环境和数据集至关重要。我们已经构建了HAI测试床，它提供了自动控制所有传感器和执行器的功能。此外，我们还发布了一个名为HAI数据集的控制系统数据集，该数据集是根据一个有预谋的物理攻击场景从测试床上获得的。尽管HAI数据集充分模拟了现场设备的行为，但该数据集不包含网络攻击通过网络传播的阶段。在本研究中，我们扩展了HAI测试床以再现和分析网络攻击，并验证了扩展的HAI测试床。
papers.title_zh: 海报：扩展可编程的CPS测试床以进行网络攻击分析

papers.title: Poster: Challenges in Stopping Ticket Scalping Bots
papers.authors: Hao-Cheng Yang, Hsun Lee, Hsu-Chun Hsiao
papers.abstract: The existence of ticket scalpers is a negative impact to all performers, audience, and primary ticket sellers. Automated ticket scalping bots, especially, generate serious damages to the online ticketing systems, and cause an extremely unfair competition between malicious ticket scalpers and normal users. However, little work had been done to address this security issue and propose solutions. In this paper, we will formulate this problem, propose an evaluation framework to systematize some known defenses, and provide several directions that can be further researched to mitigate automated ticket scalping bots.
papers.abstract_zh: 票贩子的存在对所有的表演者、观众和初级票贩子都是负面影响。特别是自动倒票机器人对在线售票系统造成了严重的破坏，并导致恶意票贩子和正常用户之间极不公平的竞争。然而，在解决这一安全问题和提出解决方案方面几乎没有做什么工作。在本文中，我们将阐述这个问题，提出一个评估框架来系统化一些已知的防御措施，并提供几个可以进一步研究的方向来减轻自动倒票机器人。
papers.title_zh: 海报：停止门票剥皮机器人的挑战

papers.title: POSTER: Construct macOS Cyber Range for Red/Blue Teams
papers.authors: Yi-Hsien Chen, Yen-Da Lin, Chung-Kuan Chen, Chin-Laung Lei, Chun-Ying Huang
papers.abstract: More and more malicious apps and APT attacks now target macOS, making it crucial for researchers to develop threat countermeasures on macOS. In this paper, we attempt to construct a macOS cyber range for the evaluation of red team and blue team performances. Our proposed system is composed of three fundamental components: an attack-defense association graph, a Go language-based red team emulation tool, and a toolkit for blue team performance evaluation. We demonstrate the effectiveness of our proposed cyber range with real-world scenarios, and believe it will stimulate more research innovations on threat analysis for macOS.
papers.abstract_zh: 现在越来越多的恶意应用和APT攻击以macOS为目标，这使得研究人员在macOS上开发威胁对策变得至关重要。在本文中，我们试图构建一个macOS网络范围来评估红队和蓝队的表现。我们提出的系统由三个基本组件组成:一个攻防关联图、一个基于Go语言的红队仿真工具和一个蓝队绩效评估工具包。我们用真实世界的场景展示了我们提出的网络范围的有效性，并相信它将刺激macOS威胁分析方面的更多研究创新。
papers.title_zh: 海报：构建红色/蓝色团队的MacOS网络范围

papers.title: Trustworthy Machine Learning: Past, Present, and Future
papers.authors: Somesh Jha
papers.abstract: Fueled by massive amounts of data, models produced by machine-learning (ML) algorithms, especially deep neural networks (DNNs), are being used in diverse domains where trustworthiness is a concern, including automotive systems, finance, healthcare, natural language processing, and malware detection. Of particular concern is the use of ML algorithms in cyber-physical systems (CPS), such as self-driving cars and aviation, where an adversary can cause serious consequences. Interest in this area of research has simply exploded. In this work, we will cover the state-of-the-art in trustworthy machine learning, and then cover some interesting future trends.
papers.abstract_zh: 在海量数据的推动下，由机器学习(ML)算法，特别是深度神经网络(DNNs)产生的模型正被用于关注可信度的不同领域，包括汽车系统、金融、医疗保健、自然语言处理和恶意软件检测。特别值得关注的是在信息物理系统(CPS)中使用ML算法，如自动驾驶汽车和航空，对手可能会导致严重的后果。对这一研究领域的兴趣急剧增加。在这项工作中，我们将涵盖可信机器学习的最新发展水平，然后涵盖一些有趣的未来趋势。
papers.title_zh: 值得信赖的机器学习：过去，现在和未来

papers.title: Robust and Verifiable Information Embedding Attacks to Deep Neural Networks via Error-Correcting Codes
papers.authors: Jinyuan Jia, Binghui Wang, Neil Zhenqiang Gong
papers.abstract: In the era of deep learning, a user often leverages a third-party machine learning tool to train a deep neural network (DNN) classifier and then deploys the classifier as an end-user software product (e.g., a mobile app) or a cloud service. In an information embedding attack, an attacker is the provider of a malicious third-party machine learning tool. The attacker embeds a message into the DNN classifier during training and recovers the message via querying the API of the black-box classifier after the user deploys it. Information embedding attacks have attracted growing attention because of various applications such as watermarking DNN classifiers and compromising user privacy. State-of-the-art information embedding attacks have two key limitations: 1) they cannot verify the correctness of the recovered message, and 2) they are not robust against post-processing (e.g., compression) of the classifier. In this work, we aim to design information embedding attacks that are verifiable and robust against popular post-processing methods. Specifically, we leverage Cyclic Redundancy Check to verify the correctness of the recovered message. Moreover, to be robust against post-processing, we leverage Turbo codes, a type of error-correcting codes, to encode the message before embedding it to the DNN classifier. In order to save queries to the deployed classifier, we propose to recover the message via adaptively querying the classifier. Our adaptive recovery strategy leverages the property of Turbo codes that supports error correcting with a partial code. We evaluate our information embedding attacks using simulated messages and apply them to three applications (i.e., training data inference, property inference, DNN architecture inference), where messages have semantic interpretations. We consider 8 popular methods to post-process the classifier. Our results show that our attacks can accurately and verifiably recover the messages in all considered scenarios, while state-of-the-art attacks cannot accurately recover the messages in many scenarios.
papers.abstract_zh: 在深度学习时代，用户通常利用第三方机器学习工具来训练深度神经网络(DNN)分类器，然后将该分类器部署为最终用户软件产品(例如，移动应用)或云服务。在信息嵌入攻击中，攻击者是恶意第三方机器学习工具的提供者。攻击者在训练时将消息嵌入到DNN分类器中，并在用户部署黑盒分类器后通过查询其API来恢复消息。信息嵌入攻击已经引起了越来越多的关注，因为各种应用，如水印DNN分类器和损害用户隐私。现有技术的信息嵌入攻击有两个关键的限制:1)它们不能验证恢复的消息的正确性，以及2)它们对于分类器的后处理(例如，压缩)不是鲁棒的。在这项工作中，我们的目标是设计信息嵌入攻击是可验证的，对流行的后处理方法是鲁棒的。具体来说，我们利用循环冗余校验来验证恢复消息的正确性。此外，为了对后处理具有鲁棒性，我们利用Turbo码(一种纠错码)在将消息嵌入DNN分类器之前对其进行编码。为了将查询保存到部署的分类器，我们提出通过自适应地查询分类器来恢复消息。我们的自适应恢复策略利用了Turbo码支持部分码纠错的特性。我们使用模拟消息评估我们的信息嵌入攻击，并将它们应用于三个应用(即，训练数据推断、属性推断、DNN架构推断)，其中消息具有语义解释。我们考虑8种流行的方法对分类器进行后处理。我们的结果表明，我们的攻击可以在所有考虑的场景中准确并可验证地恢复消息，而最先进的攻击在许多场景中不能准确地恢复消息。
papers.title_zh: 通过错误校正代码将攻击嵌入到深神经网络中的强大和可验证的信息将攻击嵌入

papers.title: IPGuard: Protecting Intellectual Property of Deep Neural Networks via Fingerprinting the Classification Boundary
papers.authors: Xiaoyu Cao, Jinyuan Jia, Neil Zhenqiang Gong
papers.abstract: A deep neural network (DNN) classifier represents a model owner's intellectual property as training a DNN classifier often requires lots of resource. Watermarking was recently proposed to protect the intellectual property of DNN classifiers. However, watermarking suffers from a key limitation: it sacrifices the utility/accuracy of the model owner's classifier because it tampers the classifier's training or fine-tuning process. In this work, we propose IPGuard, the first method to protect intellectual property of DNN classifiers that provably incurs no accuracy loss for the classifiers. Our key observation is that a DNN classifier can be uniquely represented by its classification boundary. Based on this observation, IPGuard extracts some data points near the classification boundary of the model owner's classifier and uses them to fingerprint the classifier. A DNN classifier is said to be a pirated version of the model owner's classifier if they predict the same labels for most fingerprinting data points. IPGuard is qualitatively different from watermarking. Specifically, IPGuard extracts fingerprinting data points near the classification boundary of a classifier that is already trained, while watermarking embeds watermarks into a classifier during its training or fine-tuning process.
